description: Fun people here. Friendly folks who say hello & ask your name. People will assist you if you have one too many lol. My favorites are to get shots & margaritas. Not good for selfies as posted below.
author: Rene C.

description:
Always love the mix and the staff there but don't know if it was either a recently  hired bartender or maybe just the fact that it was a Wednesday and not weekend (staff that I know) but last night the girl behind the bar could not have had worse demeanor. After getting tipped quite well and trying to establish a friendly relationship with her, her attitude and annoyance was reflected quite transparently.   
Again I love the weekend staff there. 
But if you are serving with attitude, and basically acting like you are mad at life or hate your job then quit. 
I will be boycotting the place and telling my friends that if you want to be treated like shit to go there on a Wednesday front bar.
author: Angel M.

description:
LOVED this bar, honestly such chill vibes, good drinks and good people. 
Everyone is so accepting and loving, it was truly a beautiful thing to witness. 
The happy hour specials are dope as well, although I believe they only take cash.
author: Gabi K.

description: I had an epic happy hour here. Surrounded by the happiest people on earth, we left all our cares and worries at the door and partied it up like it was 1969. The place looked and smelled like it was from that era- divey for short. The drinks were stiff and dirt cheap. G&T for $4? Hell, yeah! We hung out at the back outdoor patio with music blasting and people mingling. It felt like a house party as if everyone knew each other - until a little fight broke out between two girls but they instantly got kicked out. Everyone cheered thereafter and went on with the party like nothing happened. Gotta love this neighborhood bar and Castro, of course. Cheers!
author: Marissa S.

description: The strongest drinks ever!!!!!! I love starting out my night here especially for happy hour! The prices are perfect for balling on budget.
author: Nick Y.

description: I do love myself a good ol' gay bar and this one is no different.  I think my brother and I were just so exhausted from traveling that we just weren't able to really enjoy the atmosphere of this place.  As much as I love a heavy pour for my whiskey, I couldn't even drink my Jameson and diet because of the lack of any soda.  I could have gone back to the bar to have them top it off with more soda, but it was a Wednesday night and not a lot of action happening.  We did like the heaters on the back patio because it allows everyone to enjoy the fresh air but also stay warm during those chilly SF evenings.  Hopefully, I can come back and check this place out when I'm ready to hit the town and have more than one drink.  This will more than likely change my experience.
author: Jamie J.

description: Wow. My soul is destroyed. I cannot believe that someone would intentionally steal from me at this bar. I gave the Latino bareback $20 for a $6 drink and he handed me back $4. I gave $1 for a tip, but it took me a minute to realize it. I couldn't believe it. I spoke up. I flagged down the bartender and told him NOPE I gave that dude $20 and he apologized profusely and made some excuse for him. I was given $10 back in addition to the $3. People be aware.
author: Arnold B.

description: Great place to start. Great drinks and atmosphere.  Love the back patio.  Pool table.  On the divey end, if that's your preference.  It's a friendly, mixed crowd.  Very light on the weekdays but it's the best time for drink specials.  Fri and Sat are packed and is a fun way to start and hang out with friends, especially on those rare sunny days here.
author: Michael D.

description: The bartenders were condescending, and our bags with our phones/jackets/computers were stolen. The door guy told us that he watched someone leave with a few backpacks about 30-mins before we asked and that it was a common occurrence that phones/bags/jackets were stolen.
author: Tara B.

description: The Mix is always a great choice! This place is nothing super fancy but I love it. The drinks are decent and very-well priced. The patio in the back of the bar is fun. Always a diverse and friendly crowd, have always struck up a conversation with someone new when I'm here. Great place to stop by before headed to the club or concert.
author: Aaron H.

description: Awesome fucking place! Literally smoked a joint in the outside patio as we got our drink on, meet a lot of new friends! I would recommend this place to anyone (Gay bar)
author: Linda C.

description: Probably one of the chilliest bars in the Castro. I love the patio, the atmosphere - the drinks! I've always had a good time while at the Mix.
author: Jeannette A.

description: I love this place and have been going there for years but be warned my wife and I both had our phones stolen from our purses while our bags were sitting next to us. It sounds crazy but it's true, I'm not blaming the bar for it, I guess I just felt too comfortable. I would also add that this is NOT a good place for your hetero bridal shower or bday party. It's a small space and nothing is more obnoxious than straight people taking up too much queer space (check your privilege if this statement pisses you off). Don't get me wrong, I'm not saying straight people are not welcome. I'm saying that there are plenty of hetero dominated bars in the city that have more room. In a world catering to straight people it's nice for us queers to have a rare welcoming spot where the rainbow family is the majority.
author: Amaris B.

description: I had a TERRIBLE experience last night. First off, in the process of getting a table that was "on the dance floor" it took about 30 minutes and the employees were just standing around. Once we got inside at seated, our table was no where near the dance floor... Actually about as far from the dance floor as humanly possible. Then when I got the bill it was 2X the amount I was told at the door and they did nothing to help when I made a comment about that. I will NEVER go back here and I was very unhappy with my experience!!
author: Forrest W.

description: Can't beat the prices for drinks.  Can't say the rest about the joint but a quick stop in for a cheap buzz is what this place should be used as!
author: Yadi G.

description: Tonight sat 2-10-2018...10:55pm.. we decided to walk in to have some drinks for my girls bday. The bartender was cool and nice. Anyway after I paid of course I took my change and tip our bartender $3 for 2 drinks. We like the atmosphere till a crazy,  short , short hair old lady Bitch with glasses which bartender said is a regular came behind me and said" (bitch)Are you from here? (Me) yes. (Bitch) no I mean are you from the United State? Because we here in the US tip (Me and my friends) what ! we did tip you can ask the bartender yourself and on top of that why did you bring that races discriminating remark. Is it because we were the only Asian there ( Bitch) oh I apologize "  my friends and I was so mad. My girl even told the bartender what happen and he did not do or say anything so overall I will not come here if your a different ethnicity because of the awful people there which no one said or did anything . Very sad that Castro has always been a place that everyone is accepted and not treated different because you are different. All I've known and grew up here since I was 3 and and still treated different because the color of our skin. Well it's not as bad as the world around us who has no food , water, education etc. so it's nothing but a brush off my shoulder and move on . I just feel bad for that naive Bitch ... She could have approach it differently without using racial comments.... karma is a bitch!
author: Christy V.

description: This place is fun and it's no frills....everybody jives well together and there's no attitude period.  Nice to drop by and have a drink and encounter interesting people to converse with.  Paul was filling in for a co worker yesterday, as she is always there on Thursday mornings, and afternoons and he was great.  Made the tito's with fresh lime chilled straight up in martini glasses the way I like them....fresh lime and not too limey....peace and good vibes to all of you who drop by....and enjoy!
author: David V.

description:
On the rare occasions that I come to The Castro to hang out, rather than to dance, I like heading to The Mix with my guys to catch up and enjoy a drink.

-Stiff drinks
-No bull
-Pool Table
-Patio with full bar in the back
-Tv's throughout the bar
-Cheap cheap cheap. Yesterday we enjoyed $2 beers $ $5 cocktails.

Overall still a small space and spot get filled up quickly, especially the patio. Also, it's nice to be out in the back, but people smoke there and the haze can get to you if you're a non-smoker.

Then once you're inebriated enough, you can haul your drunk ass over to La Tortilla which is just around the corner.
author: Lanie L.

description:
I love coming to the Mix ever since my friends introduced me to this place.

When you first walk in, you're sort of like- that's it? You see the pool table and the bar. But then if you're sober enough to realize there's a back, you keep walking and reach an outdoor area. As a Southern California native who misses her outdoor bars, The Mix gets me. 

Drinks are strong and cheap, good indication that you must be in the Castro. Crowd's always super friendly and it's a nice place to hang out with a group of friends. I wouldn't come here if you were trying to dance- it's a more relaxed, laid back atmosphere.
author: Arezou A.

description: We were waiting in line for 15 minutes and the bartender kept serving his friends. When I finally got to the bar he told me to get in line again... horrible service... they are a**hole
author: Ricky L.

description: I was told I couldn't be there because I am straight. Even though my sexual orientation is looser than the washed out queens who go there.
author: Claudia F.

description: I don't normally write reviews but my experience here was awful. Stopped by with some friends that were visiting from out of town. Ordered three drinks and tipped a dollar per drink. Bartender was a young Asian female (irrelevant info if I actually caught her name). She was seemingly nice when I ordered my drinks which is why I tipped. She picked up the cash and as I started to walk away, she yelled at me across the bar "three dollars, that's it?!" She looked utterly disgusted and angry. I was shocked as were my friends. We left shortly after. I won't be going back.
author: Bilal K.

description:
Ooooooeh I feel so gay right now! Gay as in in happy, not as in sexual preference. But hey, that would also be possible here. All's possible here and that makes me LOVE The Mix! Marked as "my favourite bar in SF", by my colleague - I heart him for taking me here. 

First impression; wow what a small bar. Pool table, some heavy drinks (order a vodka soda and I swear you breath fire. Love it!), not bad... But then... Then I walked to the bathroom and BOOM! Second bar outside with music, people dancing, made new friends (seriously everyone was sooooo friendly), and again those strong drinks. 

Absolutely a great night, even during the week so definitely recommend in the Castro!
author: Philippine W.

description: Former and off duty employees hang out here and harass people and dominate the pool table etc.  Welcome to the frat house.
author: Nate S.

description: Went last night 8/4/17 and I'm extremely dissatisfied with my visit. Waited in line to get a drink for almost 5 minutes and the bar was pretty empty. Bartender was to busy helping her regulars. I ordered a beer and a fireball shot and the price was good but when I took my shot it was not fireball. I have no idea what she gave me but it was the most disgusting shot I've ever taken. Idk if they're refilling bottles or she just didn't care what she was serving. I'll definitely not go to her again unless I want some mystery shots.
author: José A.

description:
This is a really cool bar to hangout with some friends. The place is small and can fill up quite fast but the outside patio is just too cool not to hangout at especially those warm clear nights. The drinks are really strong and cheap; i ordered  a Jamison and ginger ale and i swear all i tasted was Jamison haha. If you don't like the smell of cigarettes this is probably not the place for you, since this is a patio bar you'll be surrounded by cigarette smokers but if you have no problems with it you'll definitely enjoy yourself.

When i went on saturday night they were playing old school '95 alternative songs and the music video projected on the wall. The Mix is just as it's name with a total different mix kind of crowd along with different mix of music genres they play compared to the normal bar and clubs around the Castro which really set this place apart from many small divey bars around the area.
author: Alex T.

description: Great staff! Really welcoming and had us staying for hours. Chill place and the staff really made it. Whoever worked may 28 at night was great!
author: Trevor R.

description:
At last, a Castro bar that's just slightly more diverse than most, with a far more lively and friendly vibe to match. Prices are fairly decent, and despite the fact that it can get quite busy here, I love how there's never any reason to feel claustrophobic because the front windows are almost always open, and because there's an outdoor patio in the back.

In a neighborhood and, increasingly, a city where non-whites are often given the cold shoulder, or simply shoved aside, this place shows that there's hope yet.
author: Vincent L.

description: Not trans-friendly. My transgender friends always get ignored by the bartenders, while everyone else gets served.
author: Ben H.

description: Not what I expected on a Thursday evening. Took a while to get a drink, the bartender focused on the regulars even though I was waiting. There was a bar outside in the back that was closed and that's where most of the people were located smoking. They had a pool table so I thought I'd be in heaven, but cushions were worn and no one shooting.
author: Claude R.

description:
I love places like this....really small inside bar leading out to a lively garden at the back of the venue. The music is a mix of pop/commercial mainly but there a seriously good bribe to both the inside and outside spaces of this place.

Big shouts on the drinks here which are honestly some of the strongest and cheapest I have ever had. Five dollars for what can only be described as pure vodka tinted black....known in other venues as a vodka and coke.....wow....

Best venue I have found in the Castro if you want chatty drinks rather than dancing :)
author: Daniel G.

description: This place was so awesome! Super friendly, smoker patio and just a fun place to hang out
author: Brittany S.

description: Torn. I love the mix but I don't want straight people to find it! A lovely crowd, friendly bartenders, stiff pours, good music. Pool table ain't bad either!! One of the best in the Castro, if not THE best.
author: Adam K.

description: It's an open air bar, a little too small for the crowd it receives. I didn't like the music they played - they were cycling through Beyonce, missy elliot, and Sean Paul for close to 90 minutes. The bartenders were really nice, but the long Island iced tea they made was the most potent I've ever had. It only had alcohol.
author: Amit D.

description:
The Mix is a decent bar in the Castro. The reason why I said decent because there's really nothing that stands out here that's expected from a bar.

They have alcohol, they have an outdoor patio in the back with a bar, they have a pool table, and they have music.

Be aware that the outdoor patio is also an area where people can smoke. I know some people don't like secondhand smoke like me so I just move away. When it's cold outside, there are heaters in the patio unlike some other bars.
author: Aj C.

description:
Came here on a whim on a Saturday night because some friends and I were visiting San Francisco (me from Arizona, and them from Fresno) and their cousin who ended up meeting us by the Embarcadero, who then took us here. 

Friend's cousin ended up meeting a friend, who we met his friends, and we ended up on the back patio which was nice. Liked that it had a more of a laid back vibe, than what I'm used to in general setting, especially a new place, and in a city you don't visit often. 

I didn't have a drink since I had been drinking since lunch, and then stopped by another place prior to coming here, but based on what I saw, they seemed to have a good selection of products. 

But, if you're a lady, I'd be a little weary about the bathrooms. They are unisex, and guys can be a little messy. 

Oh, and it's cash only.
author: Mercedes Z.

description:
Love this place; however, I've have now had the worst experience with the blonde elderly bartender. she was overly demanding toward what I wanted and wasn't able to recommend anything because she didn't know what would be good for a "sweet tequila cocktail" 
So, I suggest any new customers to not get a margarita because they will over charge you for tequila and don't come in the day because this woman will be there demanding your order.
author: Andria R.

description:
The Mix Is Truly The Heart Of Diversity In The Castro.

Indeed, one of my Top 5 choices for, playing pool, mingling, having a smoke or having a good drink. This bar truly stands by its name, "The Mix" because it's truly a mixed crowd. 
Old & Young
Fit to Fat
Black & White
Daddies to Twinks

The atmosphere is very chilled,
Inside there's a Pool Table,  Full Bar & Great Music. (Top 40 - 90's)
They have an outside patio which I absolutely love.
The audience there is very colorful and warm, meaning Nice Colorful Lighting with Heated Lamps, another Bar, and this is a Smoking section as well. 
There's TVs back there to watch your sports games or music videos.
If it's raining don't hesitate to not come out To this bar, " they have you covered, literally"
When it rains, the outside patio is covered so you can still have that outside experience without getting rained on. 
The outside patio is really where the magic of The Mix happens....

Wanna get a Way from the typical, traditional bars ? The Mix is your destination.
It's a mellow bar.
A local bar.
A cash Only Bar
And Last my favorite A FREE BAR....  (No Cover) 

So I recommend this bar if you're just starting off your night or just need a nice relaxing night out. 

THE MIX.... COME MIX IT UP... 
5 Mixed Stars
author: Anthony J G.

description:
Sooooo
Having a nice drink....
Roach crawls across he counter between our drinks. 
If I could give negative stars, I could. 
Yuck!!!
author: Kim L.

description:
Located in the heart of the Castro.

Pros: Juke box, pool table, and dual bar with outside patio. Lots of tvs and a happy hour with reasonably priced beers and wine.

Cons: can get very crowed during sport games and the outside patio can get stuffy when everyone begins to smoke cigs. It also becomes very difficult to get a drink during rush hour.
author: Mel L.

description:
It's a no frills smoky bar that sits in the center of All Things Castro. I love it.

Cash only and a crappy ATM fee. Bartenders pour strong drinks. Frozen margaritas at all hours.

Guys can get crabby on the patio if the place is overcrowded, but I guess that's true with most SF bars. It really is a "mix" of customers, which for me is the best part. I can talk to people just to talk. I don't like how polite they are to neighbors, though. Turning off the music on the patio at 11ish? Lame.
author: David S.

description:
It is always a fun bar to stop in and grab a drink or 2 with good friends. 
The prices are good and drinks are nice and strong...
author: Mateo M.

description: Love the mix.  Great local hang out spot.  Bartenders are always nice and fast.  I like their lit up back patio
author: Chelsea D.

description:
+ Cheap beer
+ Nice patio seating
+ Good music
+ Outdoor TV's with good sound
+ Heat lamps
+ Plenty seating


! - cash only
! - watch your drink, there are shelves in the restroom for this (thank you)
author: Ryan K.

description: Nice open air bar, and great margaritas. I love that it is also pet-friendly during the day for a happy hour. Overall, the prices are good and drinks are nice and strong. Didn't stay there past happy hour, but I am sure its fun.
author: Diane S.

description: Great bar! I don't usually frequent the back patio but there is one if you want to enjoy the sun or just put a little smoke in the air. Staff is amazing just don't piss them off otherwise, you could probably get away with murder.
author: Matthew M.

description:
Cash Only

The Mix was the first gay bar I have been to since I moved to SF. This was certainly a unique experience that no words can really explain. I definitely felt out of place but thankfully the people I was with were cool and helped me to adjust. 

Apparently, drinks served in the Castro area are cheaper and stronger than most areas so that's definitely a plus. 

They have a large space with a pool table in the main area and a great outdoor area with a second bar area. They play a good mix of music and allow you to smoke outside. The bathroom set up is co-gender 

Overall Thoughts

A lively atmosphere serving reasonably priced drinks with a heavy pour
author: Eddie W.

description: Friendly service and people. Come as you are with no judgments made. Like the title indicates it's a large mix of people that just want to enjoy a drink and play pool sometimes while socializing with friends and new people.
author: Peter T.

description:
I'm not sure why this is categorized under "Dance Clubs" on Yelp. As many times as I've been here, I've never seen any dancing, not "dance club" dancing, at least.

Personally, this is my fave spot in the Castro. I like to chill and lounge, and this spot has plenty of room to do just that. There's a spacious outdoor area in the back with plenty of seating, but it can still pack up pretty fast on some nights. There are two bars with friendly bartenders and solid drinks. The crowd is probably the most diverse for the area (all ages, all identities) and I love that!
author: Helen L.

description: Now this is a bar. Larry the owner is nice. Bartenders are nice. Bouncers are nice. Never had any problems here and frequently the place often. If I was to ding one thing, it's the back patio. Unfortunately, there not much you can do to control the smoke, crowdedness, and loudness beside restricting access. I tend to stay inside which is fine. Ok fine, second ding...music videos could also use a boost :-P. I'm still going to keep coming back with my friends as the drinks are GREAT and perfectly priced. Heart this place.
author: Honest C.

description:
I moved away from San Francisco about 15 years ago, but still visit several times a year. Back then, I think this place was called Charlie's? Uncle Charlie's? Doesn't matter. Mix is always my first stop of the night and sometimes it's the whole night. The drinks are great & the prices for, say Grey Goose, are nicely priced. I like the patio very much. It's great for people watching and striking up random conversations with such a random crowd. If you wanna hook-up, you can do that. I have. If you wanna just people-watch, you can do that, too, and it's a great place for it. It does get quite elbow-to-elbow as the night goes on, so get your spot early!

If I had a vote, I'd beg them to accept credit cards...it's a pain in the ass to hand over $200+ in $20's, over the course of a night (even more, depending if I bring friends, or make friends)  Also....imagine! People running a tab can be more generous, spending far more...I know some nights at other bars, I don't even know what I spent until the next morning.
author: Tony M.

description: Couldn't have a better name. Crowd is diverse, fun, and relaxed. Bartender named Michelle gave me the best pour for a RB+vodka for only $7. Way to my heart. 10s across the board. Fun place to start your night, play pool, or have a relaxed conversation with friends.
author: Peter B.

description: I love coming to the Mix! Its one of my favorite bars in the Castro. they know how to make a stiff drink and they are affordable compared to the other bars. And they have a patio in the back with music. Its a great place to come and relax. Pretty much every time I go to the Castro I make a stop at the Mix.
author: Thomas J.

description:
Sure its sticky and I regularly walk home instead of use the restroom here...

But the beer is decent, the vibe is unpretentious, and the back patio is an AWESOME place to meet a group of friends on a Sunday Funday.  They have TVs out there to watch football or (zzz) the Gigantes.

No food...no problem - grab a pizza across the street and bring it over.

I love that nobody feels out of place here and all can "come as you are" - in drag or in your workout clothes.
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
The downside:
Cash only bar 

The upside:
This bar never let's us down when we're in town. Definitely my favorite bar in Castro. It's predominantly men and I am a married lesbian. At a typical male gay bar the men are not very welcoming. They look at you like you're taking up valuable space that another man can be at. NOPE NOT HERE. Bartenders are very friendly to all us and treat us equally. 

$14 for a Whiskey Sour with Jack not too shabby! 

See you again when we're in San Francisco.
author: Liz N.

description:
As a heterosexual woman, I visited this place occasionally with friends who were semi-regulars. The drinks are a kick in the head - be careful with their margaritas, for they are formidable and too many will leave you forgetting where you live.

The back patio is the place to be - but it's quite cramped. At least it gives you the chance to make new friends [which I have, many times]!

An adorable dive in the heart of the Castro... very recommended.
author: Stephani C.

description:
Gay Bar Pub Crawl, Part 2. 

This was another loud, crowded gay bar. I get that it was a Friday night, so I am most certainly not complaining. Lower lights, pool tables, and again--a strong pour. (I really, really appreciate that).  

We stood out on the back patio this time, surrounded by tiki torches. Again, we shouted at each other over the din of noise, had gay guys sort of elbow their way past to get to their friends (Saying "excuse me" never hurt anyone, ladies), and we bounced after one drink. 

I wish there were more to say. It seemed a lot like Midnight Sun in terms of the crowd, while physically it had lower ceilings, a place to smoke, and a more intimate(?) feel. Not sure if that's the word, but whatever. I enjoyed my vodka tonic.  

3 Stars.
author: Nathan I.

description: I can't believe I haven't written a review of this place. I've been here several times and it has neighborhood bar feel to it. It's not "upscale" like Beaux but has a nice homely kinda feel to it. Large patio in the back to kick back.
author: Kenson K.

description:
I love it here. 
Happy Hour drinks are really, really cheap,it's a nice and fun atmosphere with a loud outside patio.
Absolutely relaxed place to go to when you just wanna grab a beer during the week.
Longdrinks are as strong as they can get. You might wanna order a chaser on the side if you can't take it.
author: Caroline K.

description:
The front of this place honestly looks pretty sketch. It's all low-ceilings, dim lights, and pool tables. When I was here, not too many people were making use of this area so it was just a few random lurkers playing pool or loitering which did not give off a great first impression. Once you walk past this though and through this little door in the back, there's a cool outdoor area and it's a complete change in mood. 

ATMOSPHERE is friendly, chattery, and fun. There's a full bar here too that looks like a giant wooden lemonade stand. There are hanging lights and umbrellas with tables to stand at. It kind of feels like you're in someone's back yard.

SERVICE is fast and efficient. They're also really friendly and talkative. Because of the backyard, it starts getting crowded even on a Thursday afternoon so maybe try to come earlier, especially in the summer.

If you don't regularly frequent Castro for nightlife, The Mix might be a cool place to come. Definitely was not expecting the back patio area to be so nice and it certainly was a good experience.
author: Junes S.

description:
In the ever changing neighborhood that is The Castro, The Mix is still an oasis amongst the craziness that is 18th/Castro.

The best thing about The Mix are the bartenders. And owner, Larry, who cares so much about his neighborhood, his customers, his staff. 

Silvia, Sloane & Gil have been slinging drinks for years and they do it with charm and professionalism.  The reason the bar is packed is because of these 3 amazing people. 

When I was in need of human spirit, back in the day, The Mix was my go to place of solace. 

Whether sad or happy, this is the place to drown your sorrows or cheer to the new job, apartment, boyfriend. 

Just know this:  Silvia saves lives.  She is a Godsend and I am happy to call her my friend.

CASH ONLY, ATM on premise.
author: James S.

description: The Mix bar is a favorite because of it's patio that allows people to smoke.  When major sporting events occur, they have all their tv's turned on.  The place has been remodeled in bits in pieces and still doesn't have a cohesive look or feel beyond a neighborhood bar.  The restroom area is all pink and while it functions a whole helluva lot better than before, it doesn't make any sense from a design perspective.  At any rate, you will feel comfortable there.  If you smoke, you'll love it because it's only 1 of 2 bars that allow smoking on the premises.
author: Shaun W.

description: Even though the back bar can get smoky, that is certainly the place you want to be. The inside is alright too, with pool tables and all, but the island-themed patio is so much better. There's also heat lamps, plenty of stools, benches, and standing room. I love that they make themselves out to be a neighborhood bar, unlike the other dance bars in the vicinity. This one is actually homey. The bartenders are awesome, fast, and real hardworking. I don't think I ever saw them take a breather for a single second. The drinks are strong and keep you going. The beers on tap were not impressive, so stick with the well drinks or cocktails. The long island iced tea and tokyo tea was great. As exposed as the restrooms look, are nothing to fear.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Honeymooning visitor, here. I was under the impression that Castro was our mecca, our one place in the US to be "at home" and enjoy gay bars that welcomed all of the queer community. As a bar that comes up on the list of "greatest bars in SF" according to Google, I was disappointed.

I am not a hot gay man with 6-8 pack abs and I am not a regular, but damnit I am a paying customer that would love a drink in a timely fashion. One bartender was more interested in the cute boy at the end of the bar and the other walked past me, twice, before asking what my order was. If I was looking for that kind of service I would go back to Charlie's in Phoenix -- at least they have an awesome taco stand next door. My wife and I ordered two draft blue moons -- you can't really go wrong there -- but the 10 minutes it took to get noticed was a bit ridiculous.

Once we sat down, we commenced people watching. I enjoyed the three games of pool I watched -- damn, it would have been nice to get a chance to play instead of the guy setting up the table and waiting for his friend for 20 minutes. Real mature, Mr. I'm-A-Regular-Here Guy. Give someone else a chance, yo.

I guess it's a "thing" in San Francisco to only be a cash bar (QBar, Twin Peaks, The Lexington Club, I'm lookin' at you, too) but holy hell is that irritating.

I give this place 1 star for the diversity and 1 star bc my Blue Moon was delish and only $3. Remember that lesbians are paying customers too, Bartenders, and you might get even better tips from us.
author: Amanda B.

description: Castro dive, good happy hour. Drinks never disappoint. Good music or something interesting on the television. Cash only!! Not a lot of space to sit, but there's a pool table!
author: Ifetayo H.

description:
I tend NOT to be a neighborhood bar guy. There are a few reasons for this. Firstly, for some reason, it seems (to me) that they are far cruisier than the dance clubs in the area... I know, that's opposite of what people usually say. But I think that in a neighborhood bar there's a different sense of 'friendliness' and the acceptability of talking to total strangers. When you're a regular here, people tend to get a sense of who is there to hang with friends, who is there to meet people, who is there to be generally social, and it's all good. But as an outsider, in a neighborhood bar, I think that people are more likely to chat you up than in a busier venue, and if you just want to kick it with friends, that can be annoying after a time. But I digress...

The Mix is one of the better venues of its type. The large back patio is inviting, the people are friendly but maintain boundaries, the bartenders are chill. I knew I was back in SF when I saw a young guy (early 20s) pull out a bong and hit it right at his table, looking fairly unconcerned that anyone in the bar would take offense. Too funny.

Cheap drinks, good overall vibe, fun times.
author: Sean B.

description:
I didn't find anything particularly interesting about this spot - it was okay.  It does have a patio area, which I guess could be nice on a warm, sunny day, but it's just okay - a very basic, somewhat run-down, set-up.  The drinks were fine.

I guess when I go out, I want to experience something different or interesting and here it just feels like sitting in someone's backyard.
author: Ken G.

description:
I am highly susceptible to clever marketing ploys. Take this super creative idea I recently fell for at Mix: a sign.

Yes, a sign near the bar with a picture of Henry Weinhard's Root Beer (my favorite root beer!) The moment I saw it I wanted one. The rest of the boys ordered cosmos. . .but I was firm.

Then Sean, who was buying the first round, walks back from the bar and hands me a rocks glass. I am puzzled. Where is my dark bottle of Henry Weinhard's Root Beer? Turns out the bartender has given me a root beer shot? What the heck is a root beer shot?

When I took it back to the bar and pointed at the sign that got me craving the root beer in the first place he begrudgingly got me my bottle in exchange for that nasty shot.

Moral of the story? If you want a non-alcoholic beverage at Mix you better be loud and proud about it or else you might get stuck with a root beer shot.
author: Miriam W.

description: Randomly ended up here this weekend because of one thing: their back patio. It did not disappoint! Stayed for a couple beers before moving on, but any bar with an outdoor space on a beautiful day in SF is a gem in my book. Had a happy hour (that lasted 7 hours) on a Saturday too = win. Cash only.
author: Lauren C.

description:
After an early dinner nearby we were walking around the neighborhood, and stopped in here for a drink. 

The bartenders were fast, and and the bar has a great neighborhood feel. I loved the mix of music that was playing, and would totally stop here again when I'm nearby.
author: Amanda G.

description:
This is probably the closest thing Castro will ever get to a dive bar. (It's not like the Mission is all that far, if that's what you're craving), but it was a great chill spot to meet a friend who didn't want to hit the dance floor while the sun was still up. (In other words, he's from out of town.)

The Mix was appropriately busy without being packed, and the bartenders were on the spot, so nobody waited long for service. It's a friendly environment, the pool table takes up a bit more room than recommended so it probably gets packed on a late night, but if you want a place to just sit, drink and mingle in the Castro, The Mix could be your spot!
author: Kevin B.

description: I absolutely love the staff at this bar.  Everyone is so friendly, funny and generally kind every time I've been there.  They don't even complain when I order coffee or a Calistoga.  Thanks to Sloane, Sean, Silvia, Todd and Buddy.  Killer staff!  Love you guys!
author: Matt A.

description: Affordable drinks. Friendly crowd. And indoor and back porch options. Good if you are bringing your posse with you. Plus ADA friendly!!
author: Regina D.

description: After this experience I had a chance to meet with Sylvie and discuss the situation. Not only has she worked with the staff around acceptable processes, she has made me feel like I am a member of the Mix family. Truly a landmark for SF, and one of my favorite places to grab a drink, eat your food & socialize.
author: Kai N.

description:
Wandered in here on a Friday night, because it seemed less packed than most places. Was with a friend visiting from out of town, who was really excited to be in the gay mecca of the USA. 
I was with my partner - we're two ladies, he's a dude. He paid 1$ less on every drink and got faster service..... So that's pretty uncool. I get it, it's a gay bar, you're catering to the gay crowd, but hey there, mr probably straight anyway bartender, we planned on tipping too. So, yeah.

The patio was great, the drinks were good and strong. Great crowd of people.
author: Kristin T.

description: Best no-attitude bar in the neighborhood. Friendly crowd, amiable staff, pool table, and comfortable back patio.
author: Aldus M.

description:
Awesome gay bar for straight people. My girlfriend and I went with a large group of friends and we had a blast. The music was fun, the crowd was rowdy and friendly. 

The drinks were strong and the bartenders were some of the friendliest I have met. 

If you want to go to brunch at Lime and then come here, you definitely should!!! 

Also, if you are starting your night out in the Castro, make this your base of operations. 

Sincerely,
Straight Dude/Girlfriend haver/Fan of the Gays
author: Lucas L.

description:
Best parts of the Mix:
~Super friendly patrons
~Awesome bartenders
~Fun music
~Chillaxy back patio, with rolling cover depending on the weather.

The only thing I would change would be the restroom. Ick. I'm fine with non-gender-segregated bathrooms, but do the urinals have to be right next to the women's stall? The floor is always wet, and it ain't from frequent mopping.
author: Umilia M.

description: After 15 years of attending this bar I ran into the most disgusting issue ever. One of the Bar backs who attempted to hit on my husband ( by trying to kiss him when I went to the restroom a few weeks earlier) and got turned down was allowed to use my disabilities to discriminate and make me feel unwelcome. I recently lost my hand and have had all the muscles in my back removed and tendons in my legs harvested for transplant into the remaining part of my arm leaving me unable to stand for periods of time. The bar back actually came and took a stool from me saying I cannot have a stool on that side of the patio ( where lots of other stools are located) then when I told him I need it and when he pulled it away he told me to sit on a bench while shoving other people's drinks ( they were drinking) off on a frenzy. He proceeded to carry it away while smiling at my husband and giving me a F you look.  Not sure if I should take this straight to management whom keeps him for unknown reasons that doesn't include courtesy to patrons  or deal with a discrimination  claim which isn't the bars fault Any more than allowing their staff to do this
author: Brad B.

description: Cool hangout spot in Castro. Little patio out back (gets smokey), pool table, and a nice crowd!
author: Jill B.

description: One of the few places you can have a drink and a smoke in the back and catch the sun on sunny days while watching a ballgame.
author: John B.

description: We came here for last call (gays always run so late). They made us insanely strong drinks. After one, I was outside siting on a random stairwell cracking up. This was a great way to start one of the most memorable, crazy night I had in San Francisco.
author: Darija D.

description: A great place to hangout. Fun neighborhood vibe. Down to earth place. Good drinks. Friendly service. What more could you ask for?
author: Jonas K.

description:
Preferred hangout bar. Great back patio with heaters, seating.. The works. 

Great beers on tap, and the bartenders are incredibly pleasant and more often than not remember what I ordered last, ready to pour the next round.
author: Scott R.

description: Surprising really good! Here is what u should expect, a warm unglazed donut with ice cream inside. It's not overly sweet and the donut is amazing just by itself. Believe it or not, I wouldn't mind the donut by itself or the ice cream by itself. Both together is really good!
author: Giang N.

description: Nice bar wtih pool table, patio, good staff
author: Robert S.

description:
Some friends and I started our night out at Q-Bar last weekend, and ended up here.

Drinks were good, but it really sucks when you really have to pee, but get the [unlocked] women's stall door shut in your face because people happen to be having sex in the stall.  Keep it classy!!
author: Katie M.

description: Great neighborhood bar in the Castro - great staff, great crowd of regulars!  On our visit, had the chance to visit with an old friend from when I lived here who is now bartending at the Mix - so, go by and see Buddy - great bartender, great guy!
author: Jerry T.

description:
I like the Mix - it's comfy, casual, good drinks (strong!), pretty friendly people (mostly) and outdoor/indoor seating. Also, there is pool, a juke box and clean bathrooms. 

It's centrally located in the Castro where I can easily meet friends for drinks without having to go too far. 

Great place to just chill and talk with friends or even a date (if very casual).
author: Jason B.

description: Fun place to grab an afternoon drink and hang on the patio with friends.
author: Lyric A.

description:
Not the best place if you want a cheap, strong drink. Other places have two for one drinks with strong pours. This is usually a wind the night down place for me, or a im tired of hearing Britney blasting across the street so I'll come here to chill.

The bartenders are hit or miss. There are a few usual bartenders that are pretty nice to me. The ones that are a bit sketchy are chubby blonde lesbian, and the buffer looking latino guy, not Gil. His drink prices are inconsistent.

I consider myself a regular here, yet everytime I come here, the regulars look at me like I'm some creep out of Kansas. Patrons here are pretty grimey and gross looking for the most part. Pretty prissy too. Especially on the back patio area. And dont get me started on the Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence. Everytime they come here, they think they own the place. Needless to say, this place is full of gay attitude. I dunno if the patrons get it from the staff or vice versa.

Either way, I dont come here to be friendly with others, I come to enjoy company with who im with so all the bitchy queens can pretty much kiss my ass
author: A W.

description: This is a fun little bar with a great atmosphere. There is a nice inside area with a pool table and an outdoor/partially covered patio. Bumped into a ton of nice people here. Great crowd.
author: Tacia C.

description: Amazing bar. Great atmosphere. Nice people. This is the bar to go to in the Castro. Bartenders are incredibly friendly and people are great. If you want to have a drink and a good time this is the place to be
author: Joshua C.

description:
I would give this a 5, but I am trying not to be biased, as service is spotty sometimes, and it is cash only.  However, it is easily my favorite bar in the city, gay or straight, and I am not gay.  I do not go to bars to meet girls, or try to get laid, nothing like that.  I go to bars to drink, hang out with friends, people watch, and get some ridiculous stories.  And, depending, if I am drunk enough, to dance my sweet little ass off. 

This bar has a great patio to hang out with friends and people watch, the general clientele is all very friendly, and unlike some gay bars, where being the straight one is frowned upon, no one seems bothered by the fact that I am there, and many still offer to buy a drink, even when I say "Just so you know, I am straight."  Sure, to my hopefully narcissistic self, I take this to mean they find me sexy as hell and hope they can get me drunk to woo me, but hey, if they want to try, as long as I am honest, why the hell not?  

As far as the stories from people watching or drunken friends go, I have many.  From the time my female friend decided to walk around topless after allowing some random guy to touch his first vagina (hers) and then those two made out with my other friend, only for her to be left out as my gay friend and this random guy disappeared into the bathroom to 'service each other" as I walk in to witness it, to the time when one of my friends legit pimped out me and another guy for drinks.  (Yes, this happened: story,  girl I was seeing came with me, two gay friends, and a straight buddy.  Guy approaches us, we say we are straight, but she is our pimp.  He proceeds to hand her cash if she will make us spin around and or let him touch our butts.  She then used the money to buy rounds for everyone involved, the payer included, and then returned all the change to him.  He hung out with us the rest of the night.)  

The patio allows smoking,  and based on what I have witnessed, not just tobacco. There is a bar inside or outside, the margaritas are KILLER, and every drink is strong as hell (think Pop-Eye on Spinach).  There is pizza across the street, and pretty much any major bank I can think of within half a block, so  cash only shouldn't be an issue.  

When I say I would choose this bar over any other in the city, I do not exaggerate.  My best nights out in the city either start or end here, and sometimes, both.
author: Dick S.

description:
I'll try to trace back how I finished my Saturday night here.
i went for a Hike at Muir Woods, had dinner at Stinson Beach, drove back to the city, went bowling for the first time in my life at the Yerba Buena center and then all hell broke loose.

I don't know if the beer was particularly strong or if the 7 mile uphill fast pace hike contributed for my accelerated drunk state.

When I situated myself after leaving the Bowling Alley we were at the entrance of Le Cafe. The 4 bloody/ drunk individuals being handled by the police and the half naked dude dancing inside kinda threw us off so we just walked around until we found the Mix.

I guess Alex and Paul had a very attractive phenotype for the crowd/ bartenders,  the service was uberfast and everyone was friendly.
At some point I got tired so I extracted myself from the group to sit down (in the back patio) 8 friendly gay man joined me to try to figure out where I got the polka dress and matching shoes. Eventually one of them mumbled some words in portuguese and my two working neurons at that moment recognized him as Jamie (the sweet guy that gives me forearm massages at the Aveda store at the Westfield).
I had a few more drinks with them, noticed how revealing the mirrors behind the seating spots can be (i guess it gave me a different view of 3 three way makeout session LOL).

Leaving the place I said goodbye to everyone (including the friendly bartender that was telling us endearingly that we needed to leave, that the place was closing), got distracted for a microsecond and lost my group. 
While trying to find my pack some random huge guy hugged me and said I was gorgeous (I suppose he was extremely inebriated or he just didn't take a good look at me).

It is a fun place and I will definitely get lost there again.
author: Bea L.

description:
I'm not much of a bar guy. But when I do hit the bars in SF on my visits, the Mix is a great place for me to go. Nice space outback, quiet for the most part, easy to get to the bar.

There's a really friendly unpretentiousness there, which is something considering the attitude going on a block away. That's what I really like about it.
author: Tom M.

description: love the pool table was a designated driver for a friend
author: Leigh G.

description:
When I drink, I smoke
So their patio just rocks
Bartenders are HOT
author: Jesse S.

description: a fun place, good music and drinks! excellent outdoor patio for smoking!
author: Marwan M.

description: Great outdoor patio; especially when it's raining outside! (Perfect for smokers!) & the music was up to date and perfect for the Castro!
author: Haley K.

description:
1-star for the bad bartenders on a Thursday night. The butch dyke with the bleached, short hair working the bar in the front needs to be fired. How hard is it to be professional? I'm not even asking for politeness, good manners or, god forbid, a smile. All I ask for is that the person I'm PAYING my hard-earned money to leave the attitude at home and to just be professional on the job. And professional, this woman was NOT. Really, if a "neighborhood bar" needs to rely on repeat customers and good, word of mouth testimonials to stay afloat, then I think the owners should think twice about keeping this person on board.

And the Latino bartender in the back. Wow. Not sure why the drinks he was pouring for me were 10x's weaker than the ones he poured for my friends. Whatever his reasons were, that wasn't cool.

Why, oh why do the bartenders who worked here that night think that they can be assholes when there are PLENTY of great bars nearby with better service? There are a lot of great places to drink and socialize in the Castro. Nothing makes this bar more special than the rest. So, to the bartenders that night, stop being assholes because you are taking this business downhill. I'm taking my money elsewhere. I don't have patience for bullshit. That is all.
author: Tita L.

description:
I was always hesitant going the this bar but last night I figured out why. There was a twinkish Asian-American (the reason I mentioned the his ethnicity is so he knows who he is) guy that was ignoring his clients across the board.  It appeared that there was a problem with the videos and there were two guys taking care of the problem - he kept getting involved with the technical part of the videos and ignoring his patrons.  The guy that was cleaning the bar was also ignoring the patrons.  

What a freaking JERK.  I am certain that I will go back and give it a 2nd chance but it is going to be a while before I go there again.  

The environment was okay and I see a lot of potential but with unprofessional bartenders, it will loose customers like it did last night.  I walked out and went to Midnight Sun and as always, the bartenders were attentive and friendly.  

Sorry MIX - I am not a fan of yours and I am certain there are other guys that walked out as upset as I was.
author: Eric J.

description:
This is a neighborhood gay bar.  It's not fancy.  It's not necessarily fun on its own.  The crowd seems to lean older, higher up on the BMI scale, and less facially symmetric.  I'd recommend for Saturday or Sunday day drinking.  You know, a nice warm up before you go somewhere with a bit more flash in the pan.  What does that mean anyway?  Flash in the pan?  I personally have always liked Green Lantern more than the Flash.

I have determined that people use the term neighborhood gay bar when they don't want to say it's teetering on the edge of lame.  Oh, I did like the patio in the back.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
Fantastic back porch with plenty of sun, benches, and tables.
What's there not to like?
author: George F.

description: I like how the drinks here are not super strong like Badlands. This is DEFINITELY a mixed crowd. You have ALL types of ppl here. (Age, genders, size, race, style, etc.) I have never stayed longer than 2 hours. There's not much of an area to dance. This is more like a place to come in and grab a drink and sit down. The DJ haves an eclectic taste in music. You'll hear from punk rock to pop. Can't remember but I think they have some pool tables. Back patio is a great place to get some sun if you're there in the afternoon or early evening and you can smoke.
author: Kevin C.

description:
You are in the Castro the night of game 6 of the NBA finals and need to watch the game before your dinner. Quick: where do you go?

Well, I want to seemingly 8 other "bars" on the same street before stopping at Mix to watch the game. 

What bar doesn't play the NBA finals between the Celtics and Lakers? Usually that would be a rhetorical question, but one quick hurried jaunt through the Castro answered that question. 

The scene here was lively and the staff were friendly as I was one of the few people watching the game. Everyone else was too busy having fun as I agonized over the Lakers being demolished.
author: Carlos A.

description:
I like how this place has all my bar essentials:
- pool table
- outdoor patio
- with heat lamps!
- friendly strangers
- well-lit bathrooms

This place is a good starting point to any night out in the Castro.  You get your reasonably priced drinks, nurse it out back, and then head out to the next joint.

Don't plan on getting into an intense game of pool here.  This place closes insanely early on a Wednesday night (midnight).  Fine.  We were on our way out anyway.
author: Linda T.

description: Ah the Mix, I used to be a regular. Why? Cheap, strong drinks and it's never too crowded. The Patio is pretty nice in the daytime, and overall it's just a good place to hang with friends and get tipsy. If you're looking to find a hot guy... go elsewhere. Only the bartenders are cute. Especially Gil, not sure if he still works there.
author: Chris T.

description: Came here with my friends to do a little pre-drinking, socializing, and just enjoying THE MIX. I really like the atmosphere and how the bar is set up to seem like its outside. Great music, the lighting is amazing and kuddos to the bartenders who made my drinks! It was real strong and I was totally drunk off of my Mai Thais, Thank You! Next time I'm in SF I will definitely come here again.
author: An S.

description:
As a straight girl in the castro this is one of my fav bars. Why? Because unlike badlands I don't get asked questions like "are you a lesbian or are you just here with one of your 'gay' friends." But sorry...I really was with one of my gay friends. Sometimes I like to dance to Britney with my gay friends, i can't help it if i'm straight, it's not like i'm gonna crush his game or nothing, serious, hook up at will. end rant.

Anyway, this place doesn't have any attitude. The crowd is mixed of younger and older. The people are friendly, the music is awesome (they have a jukebox with *everything*), the bartenders are sweet and pour stiff 
....ahem...drinks.

An excellent place to pre-party, have a round with friends, or shoot some pool whilst listening to Kelly Clarkson.
author: Nikki M.

description: 5 of us Got bottle service tonight.  Good times, ok waitress.
author: Paul S.

description: This is a great place...what I call our neighborhood bar.  Fantastic bartenders, reasonable prices, and I LOVE the outdoor space.  a great hidden find.  Always an interesting crowd.  Classic SF.
author: Nancy R.

description: Cool little dive bar with TV's for sports. Friendly crowd.
author: Kathy R.

description:
Some light once in awhile could wonders for this place. It's the first dive bar I've been to in the Castro and while I love seeing young kids and bears mesh in harmony, it gets a little crowded.

I've noticed the drinks change depending on who you are. Listen: my friends and I all got the same drinks. One right after another. Depending on who was cutest, they got the cheapest drink. I was right there with $6.25 an the most expensive drink was $13! Yay! I'm cute to a gay man!

The back bar is awesome with the twinkling lights and park benches to sit on. A little crowded but a very relaxed atmosphere.
author: Jessica K.

description:
This place serves Guinness,
So it's A-OK with me.  
I'm straight and loved it.
author: Josh G.

description: my go to bar in the Castro. For a beer during lunch or margaritas at the end of a long day, its one of the more inviting bars ive been to in the Castro. The back patio is awesome on a sunny day (which can be rare in the city). always go when Sylvia is working, she makes the best cherry lemonade and drinks in the bar. can be a little loud sometimes, but its my favorite either way. always come back here, first choice for me :D
author: Rosie S.

description:
Do I want to order a drink from the bartenders or just F them?  

Either way - great times to be had!
author: James V.

description:
Upon arriving, I do what I always do first (pre-intoxication). I look around, give the layout, the people, and the general ambiance a good run down. There was a pretty diverse crowd that day; plenty of men (of all shapes and colors) and a few girls here and there.. We were lured to The Mix by the potentially uber crowd and (more importantly) the outdoor patio, and the bartender instantly said that I wouldn't be able to go... (I forget - was it closed, full, or was I just not good enough?) Rejected.

After the obligatory first round of drinks, I finally realized - I obviously wasn't hot/gay/man enough to get the bartender's attention. Once again, rejected. It wasn't until we made friends with the hottie next to me who offered to talk to the bartender for us that we finally got seconds, thirds, fourths... and the rest of the night was a blur.

It's true, the drinks ARE strong.
author: Asha S.

description: I came to The Mix on St. Patrick's day and I must say, it feels kinda like home. Everyone was very friendly and social without being obnoxious; no complaints there. The drinks were VERY cheap and strong, which is also a plus. The music was good and wasn't too loud. Lot's of smoking going on outside and i could smell some weed. Didn't get a chance to play pool but I will next time if anyone is down. Can't wait to come back!
author: Tommy C.

description: Nice chill place.  It's been "remodeled". We love the bartender.  Cash only bar.
author: Trynh K.

description:
So...a Friday night and a group of friends are meeting at the Mix. I walk in (around 4/5pm) and everyone seems friendly/lively. I am ready to start my weekend. I don't see my friends at first so I walk to the back...I see them and then try to get a drink...I go back inside and ask the bartender if/when the back bar will open...I get a look (of "what the f@##")...and a scolding that it will open soon...I get my drink and move to the back patio. Patios are great concepts...and seem like a cool place to hang to get some fresh air...WRONG...this is where I decided I won't be coming back anytime soon. 

I get headaches/lightheaded around cigarette smoke...it was like being in a cloud in the "open air" patio. I was paying for it all night with my headache...plus my clothes smelled like an ashtray. I swear...it seemed like everyone in the back was blowing their smoke at me?? I mentioned the lack of "breathable air" to some of my friends and they agreed...we moved on to somewhere else (with a trail of smoke coming off my clothes).
author: Tom M.

description: If it's sunny outside, I will be here, blacking out on Budlight. Look for the brunette floozy in the back of the bar with her eyebrows drawn on, that's me.
author: Sean R.

description: Total neighborhood gay bar-- tamer than Badlands, more casual than Cafe or Blackbird, cleaner than just about all the other bars. Not as much of a good looking crowd here but I always felt like it was the perfect place to go with just one other person you really want to chat with because the noise level is just right and that back patio is fabulous!
author: Chris W.

description: Don't quite understand the appeal of this place. Its dirty and old looking and resembles a basement or garage. The bathroom is not private and shared with all genders. The back patio area is not that great in my opinion and anyway people are mostly smoking there which I am not interested in being around. It looks crappy. Why bother?
author: L. A.

description:
This is my go-to-bar when I want to drink....bartenders are friendly and they dont hit on you...;-)

and they hook you up with alcohol.

If ever your here...call me...i will drop by ;-)
author: Malou C.

description: Usually love The Mix, but plan on boycotting it for a while, if you have friends from out of state don't go here because the bartenders don't know what other state IDs look like. My boyfriend just moved here from New York and the bartender wouldn't serve him because he doesn't know how to properly check IDs. It's part of your job dude to know what other state drivers licenses look like! So we just went across the street to Moby Dicks and had no problems.
author: Joey H.

description: I was there twice while in SF.  I had a decent time.  But the bartenders seem to be disconnected with the patrons I waited almost 5 minutes before he even acknowledged me. The second time I went I couldn't believe I was actually watching the bartender smoking pot with other customers  wow that was really crazy had a beer and got the heck out of there I don't live in sf so I don't know if that's everyone's experience but I wouldn't go there.
author: Art D.

description: you have to be welcome first then you will like. the bar staff wants your money , not you there.
author: B H.

description: I love The Mix! It's my favorite gay bar in SF. They have a great happy hour on the weekends, and even during the week PBR is only $3/pint. All the bartenders are friendly. And the best part is the back patio which has a second bar. It's huge and perfect for a sunny day in the summer or a rainy day in December.
author: Candice Z.

description: This place is the tits, cats meow, or whatever she said. The bartenders are all super nice especially Tessa also see biggest smile and brightest hair in the joint. There is an outdoor patio to bask in the glories of Castro weather, hello sunshine! And if you can't wait for the ladies room, there is always room to "Mix It Up" in the coed bathroom.
author: Janelle D.

description:
THE MIX is a very chill bar. Its one of those places where everyone is welcomed and everyone would feel comfortable. The crowd, as well as the music, can be called "eclectic" at times cause like i said "Everyone is welcomed". Which can be good to some people... and NOT to others. Funny enough, theres always this guy here with a small dog running around the bar... I'm thinking "OK... I guess...Work that little Puppy!" Anyways, the decor won't win anyone over aswell, its a DIVE BAR not a GLAM BAR, but it has its charms. 

Moreover, the drinks are good and cheap! One of the bartenders, my fave at THE MIX, would always serve us large shots! They are almost the size of a double shot, and I'm like "Damn!" But I'm not complaining. Who I look like?? We all know that LARGE SHOTS = A DRUNKEN FUN TIME! So were definitely always by the bar drinking shot after shot, being a hot mess! I know I'll be dancing, I'll be dancing, tonight I'm not taking no calls cause I'll be DANCING pon de floor style... somewhere else though! Since theres no dancefloor here...it being a bar and all.

Back to THE MIX We always manage to have a good time here, its usually a good place to start and get buzzed before a night of fun, crazy, non-stop dancing, and club-hopping. Its better than buying OVERPRICED drinks at the other clubs. Its CASH ONLY though so thats kinda annoying but apparently ALL of the BARS/CLUBS in the Castro street are CASH ONLY so thats fair... I guess. But STILL were in the 21st century!
author: Lorénz B.

description:
I frequent this place when I'm hanging out with my best bud. The patio is the only place where I've ever hung out at this bar, and even though I'm a woman, I've had a great time with friends and those around me...I've never really met a fag hag, nor do I think I am one...

...as a matter of fact I don't think gay men understand women at all ^_^ heck I don't even know if I understand gay men very well!

DEBBIE!
author: Jennifer P.

description: I really liked their outdoor patio area since it was gussied up for the holidays, so little rainbow lights twinkling along the rooftop. Heat lamped and such, so it wasn't chilly at all. Plenty of space to stake out a corner to talk with a date or with friends. Definitely less crowded than the Blackbird, but of course the cocktails aren't as interesting. $5 draft beers.
author: Kevin L.

description: So, in general I hate getting dragged to the Castro. I have a few gay friends so we comprise and come to the Castro once in a while. So I went here the other day for some mid-afternoon drinks. The back patio is pretty cool but I would have to say the crowd is a little bit older than a lot of the places I have been to before and not as good looking. If i'm going to hang out in the Castro, I want to be surrounded by hot fabulous men, and this wasn't quite the case. The back patio is pretty small and janky. If you want to enjoy some cockails outdoors to enjoy the day, I would suggest The Lookout or Toad Hall.
author: Raheleh K.

description:
Cool bar.  Wednesday afternoons I believe they have a charity pool tournament you can join for $5.  At least they used to.

Nice staff...Sloan the bartender is cool.  

Smoking area out back.  

Good place for 30-something queer folks (and older) and friends.  Not full of twinks (young gay guys) like Badlands, The Bar (aka B.O.C. for Bar on Castro)  and the Cafe are.

You can watch Ellen there and L Word also....But I wish they would turn the volume up when Ellen is on.  I love Ellen.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
My first night visiting San Francisco and my friend invited me to this bar.i had alots of fun..we was hanging out in the back patio and they had this HOT LATINO bartender working..i wanted to jump over the courtner and ripe his clothes off...lol
The bar it self was clean people there were was very friendly and the drinks was very cheap
author: Mike S.

description:
My friends and I were in the area waiting for a restaurant, and decided to stop in here for a drink.  

The crowd was friendly, but not rowdy.  The bouncer at the door was a nice older man, and checked our IDs with a little skeleton lantern. Points for cuteness + festivity.  Since this IS a bar in Castro, it's definitely not for everyone, but I didn't have a hard time settling in, despite not being used to it. 

There was a $4 "True Blood Margarita" that night (10/29, so very close to Halloween). Upon closer inquiry, the special was revealed to be a cosmo, and we ordered a round.  It was strong, which was a nice surprise since so many places offer drink specials but just proceed to water them down so you really aren't getting much bang for your buck.  They also had $4 Skyy drinks and some other well specials.  

We stopped by again after dinner for another quick drink before heading to see a show.  The bouncer remembered us and chatted with us for a bit before waiving us on through.  At this point it was around 11:30 on Friday, but it still wasn't that crowded (although it definitely wasn't lonely in there!) and we were able to order drinks quickly and be on our way.
author: Vi N.

description:
Don't get me wrong, I like this bar for many reasons: the drinks are cheap and strong, the clientele is mixed and often unpredictable, they have a jukebox (which is a rare find in bars these days), there's a great neighborhood vibe here which I appreciate in a bar, and they also have a membership card that gets you drink coupons monthly (woo-hoo!)

The one thing that bothers me about this bar is how many issues I've had with the jukebox. Often there's a sign on it saying it's not working (which means the bartender is playing his iPod.) I found this out later when after seeing the sign taped to the credit card slot, I asked the bartender politely if the jukebox wasn't working or if it was just the credit card slot and he just shot me back the nastiest look and said "I have no idea" as he walked away. Then last night I put in a dollar (since there was no sign and the bar was pretty empty) and played a few songs and this same bartender commented to another patron about how he didn't like the music and that he was not surprised and to just look at us. That was rude.

I've liked their other bartenders in general, and I like this bar, which is why I gave it 3 stars. I just don't really want to go back.
author: Allister F.

description: The first gay establishment I ever went to remains the best and my favorite. Nice crowd cool set up.
author: F T.

description:
I really like this bar. But like all good things, I hated the few times going there. I went here one time a few years back with my ex. It was fun..

But yeah, this would be the kind of bar I'd hit on a Saturday if I was in the Castro and just talk to all the random boys on the patio. Then go to Delores park.

The crowd here is a lot of young gay boys...so gonna go where they are.
author: Lana P.

description:
Great neighborhood spot! Always a good place to take friends. Tho they have lots of beer busts, especially during Softball Season, I dig it. 

My friend loves their slushy drinks, but we can always find something good!

The only let down was the sleepy people here during the World Cup. Do they even KNOW soccer?
author: Gina H.

description:
Came to The Mix on Friday night and it was filled with lots of boys and some girls.... pool table, music, a little bit of seating.... overall nice crowd with back patio for smoking and unisex bathroom.

The Mix has like a "reward" program for alcohol! I love that idea! Basically for so many drinks you purchase you can get a gift card/ voucher thing to use in the bar. They even give you a sticker that they scan for each purchase! Great idea!
author: Julie F.

description: When I visit sf I always stop by the mix. Great bartenders and hot bar backs.. Sylvia is my favorite bartender, she is amazing. Great place to hang out and no drama.
author: Keith P.

description:
Cheap, fun, divey, gay, straight, internet jukebox, decent booze selection...throw these all together, give a couple of shakes, and VIOLA = The Mix!

Love love love it.  The crowd is great. The service is great. The atmosphere is divey - great place to start or end your night/day.
author: Erin V.

description: Truly the only gay sport bar in the Castro. With hints of Cheers mixed in with it.  Great neighborhood bar.
author: Titan Critic T.

description: As I embark on my fifth year of living in San Francisco, I've already assembled a mindset of "my favorite places." The Mix is my go-to bar, with that said; it is also my favorite bar. What I love about The Mix, is the loyalty it has to its name. For instance, If you go to Badlands, you'll most likely drown in a sea of top 40 mainstream gays who all have the same collared shirt from Forever 21. The Mix strives to be the complete and polar opposite of that. There's always a mix of a younger and older crowd. Twinks, cubs, otters and bears all harmonize peacefully in the beautiful back patio. The music isn't too loud and the lights aren't too dim, the ambiance is always just right. I really want to know who is in charge of the music, the play-list is always superb. It'll range from '80s to indie and rap to chill-wave, none of that crappy music you hear on the radio. The bar tenders definitely know how to pour you a strong drink, but I'm a sucker for their slush margaritas (no salt, thank you). If you're visiting San Francisco, I implore you to come mix it up at The Mix.
author: Joseph P.

description: I love this place, friendly, good drinks and always a MIXED crowd.  Great place in the hood.
author: EC N.

description:
It's nights like this that I wish I was a cute gay boy.

The Mix. Tuesdays. Hot men everywhere. $2 frozen STRONG margaritas.

Yes please.

Instead I get to play psuedo-wingwoman with my hottie little roommate and pose like supermodels when the tourists come in, see, and take photographs of a 6'2 blonde chatting up a 5' nothing gaybie on a heated patio with Scissor Sisters and Madonna playing in the background constantly.
author: Devon S.

description:
I am straight. Yes, I know I have made out with my share of women in drunken moments, but I am straight, I swear! That being said, I HATE going into a gay bar and either being labeled a "fag hag" or being relentlessly hit on. We are all just people, and I am not a fruit fly just because I have a variety of friends, nor am I "curious" just because I am in a bar that is predominantly lesbian. 

Get it through your heads people. I am not your arm candy, obligatory link to the straight world, sex toy, salt lick or any other number of things I have been mistaken for in some of the bars I have walked into in the Castro.

That being said I am happy to hang out on the awesome patio of The Mix. The atmosphere is great, the drink prices reasonable, they have  a pool table and it is a great mix of people, just hanging out with other people. I have never once felt like a salt lick here. Not once.

I have felt like a complete freak magnet here, as there are a few crazies from time to time....but I feel that way everywhere. If you hang out with me enough you will understand what I mean.
author: Drue C.

description: Typically have a decent time here, but had an unpleasant experience with unprofessional staff who really made the night end on a low note.  1:52 am, approaching closing, and a staff member said "time to go" and snatched a half full beer from my friend's hand. He then pushed him towards the door. We were standing talking peacefully, and it was incredibly rude. Will rethink coming back.
author: Michael W.

description:
Since moving to SF, I've learned a lot about gay men. First off, they're cool as shit. Second, not all of them secretly want to bone me. Lastly, some of them like to watch sports on tv occasionally. Now, I'm not talking about ice dancing or rhythmic gymnastics. No, I'm talking about "manly" sports. The NFL, NBA, NHL, boxing, college football, Nascar.

Last week, I watched a part of the AFC championship at the Mix. It was crowded. People were cheering, and not only when Tom Brady's ass came on the tv. The right parts, like first downs and interceptions and stuff. The Mix also has a nice shaded back patio with tiki torches. It almost felt like I was at a straight sports bar, until I saw a dude sitting on another guys lap. I dunno, maybe they were working on their center to quarterback exchange. 

Ok, so I admit that I've never actually met a gay man who likes Nascar. But then again, I don't know any straight men that watch rhythmic gymnastics either. If there are any, I bet they would hang out at the Mix though. 4 stars.
author: John T.

description:
Cheap and easy. Just how I like it.

It's just a bar with a mixed crowd... nothing spectacular. Drinks are pretty inexpensive so it's a good place to pre-party before heading to the club... back patio is heated and not too noisy or crowded. Music depends on who's money is in control of the jukebox!

You may or may not run into someone you know here. Actually you probably will.
author: Richard T.

description:
When I started working in retail, I fully expected the occasional overnight shift. I planned to bring a lunch, my ipod, comfortable shoes, a sweatshirt for that late-night chill that can creep up on you. But then a certain woman, who was also my supervisor, strolled into my life. 

She's a pinch of crazy mixed with some ex-gangster (no joke there) street cred and an unparalleled adoration for the life of a gay man. She also can't say most names correctly, and if she pronounces it wrong the first time, she'll most likely never get it right. 

Therefor, it could *only* be she who would ask me, after 9 hours of pm -to-am labor, if I was up for "The Mix at Six." I didn't know what that meant, but seeing as who was asking me, I knew it would probably be something I didn't want to tell my mother about. 

So my first and some of my only experiences with the Mix have been at 6am, when we were by no means alone in that bar. There were a few regulars, some people who looked as though they hadn't been home in days, and a man overly eager to compete with my supervisor in a game of pool. Classy broad, that woman. And she turned me into one swell lady myself. But at least we had worked through the night and were relaxing afterward... my other friend who woke up early just to join us borders on being an alcoholic.
author: Brian K.

description:
I have been trying to find something different to make my 200th review - something surprising, different, and uplifting... I guess The Mix fills that bill.

Having lived in the Castro for some 15 years, I frequently bemoan the lack of good quality bars restaurants and stores. Sure, if you are 20-something and/or gay and/or male and/or a Swedish tourist, you will probably enjoy the charms a packed meat-market bar with a dance-floor followed by a slice and some mediocre pasta and trip to the video store (the one next to the all-lube store - no not that all-lube store, the other one). 

I must admit that when I was a tourist (albeit, not actually gay or from Sweden - England, actually - I know, I get that a lot!) I did revel in  the insanity and debauchery of many of these establishments, but these days I look for a steady down to earth bar where I can knock back a few and laugh of the woes of the week.

That's why after all these years, I was pleasantly surprised when I finally ventured into The Mix. I guess you can't judge a book by it's cover as I had always taken this place, peering in from the outside, as a cramped and sweaty all-boys, all-the-time action bar. 

But what do you know? While the joint sits firmly and proudly on it's gay-bar monika, it is simultaneously straddling the cozy-local-bar mount. There's plenty of booze, TVs, pool tables, and welcoming bar-staff. There's a bright and breezy conservatory out back and the drinks are reasonably priced. 

The night I first went, there was a tequila promotion going on and free mini-daiquiris for everybody. WooHoo - what a pleasant surprise all round! I love this place! They don'y mind a bit if you're not from Sweden!

A word to the wise for the ladeeez - there isn't one! Ha! But you are quite welcome to slip in past the urinals and use the stall in the Gents! I am not kidding!
author: Kingpin X.

description:
If you had told me I'd be at the Mix at 6am, STILL drinking, with the most adorable barista from from my favorite Starbucks, I'd have said BULL.  SHIT.  But it happened.  At The Mix.  At 6am.

Me, Starbucks Guy, his friend, and the staff of a certain bar also on 18th St. shuffled over to The Mix as the party we were at across the street was winding down.  As daylight filtered in through the front windows, we defiantly kept drinking and shooting pool.  

We
were 
unstoppable.
