The bartender was a real gem--far more pleasant than one would expect at 6am on New Year's Day.  The drinks were strong enough to keep my drunk going for another few hours, and the jukebox was full of great music.  I had more fun than I ever thought possible during the early hours of the day.   

AND they have "Oh Sheila" by Ready For The World on their jukebox...4 minutes, 2 seconds of audio gold.
author: Eric E.

description:
Drinks are strong and cheap. The clientele is the least enthused. 

It's a good place to go when with friends and want to start the night out with some good drinks before you go to more appealing destinations. I've found that the overall crowd is steadily aging though. About a year ago it seemed about 10 years younger and now it's acquiring the same demographics as 440. 

They have a patio as well, but it's barely open - they should remedy this.

Oh, and there's never a cover. Score.
author: Anthony B.

description:
Drama! Everytime I'm here I seem to get into text-fights w/ Ramo...to the point where my fingertips ache.  He seems to think I'm doing a "toy" which is silly Tagalog slang for what you or I would consider a booty call.  This is not a reflection on the Mix, rather one of silly Pilipino voodoo superstition, gossipy apparitions and me apparently not answering his calls in a timely fashion (definition: before the phone actually rings.)

"Sorry baby...but the Mix plays the jukebox pretty loud.  I never heard the phone."  

Considering there's the vibrating feature on my phone, I'm told that this is not an acceptable excuse.  Fine...next time I'll set the darn thing to vibrate and I'll pee my pants when he calls me.  

Love you baby...really I do.

Oh, I dig this bar.
author: Mc Matty b.

description:
I love the Mix.  As someone who enjoys playing poole and being out early in the morning, I don't think I've ever been to a better spot.  Bartenders are all awesome, and the outdoor patio is great if you want to get some sun and have a quick smoke.  

At night it gets a little hyphy so watch out!  Sundays are a blast.
author: Jonathan M.

description:
I love me some Mix, it's always just what I need.  The crowd is oh so nice, the pool table is always being used, the back porch is clutch, and the drinks are good.  Mind you this is not what I would consider a pristine bar, but it's great.

Oh (and I never do this, but she was just that good), if you go and there's a blonde chick that quasi looks / acts like Pink go to her.  She'll be the best lay you never had.
author: Girls Named Cherise C.

description:
This is a good place to unwind with friends. They have pool in the main room, but there is always someone using it, so good luck on that. I remember this place used to get super busy, where pool sticks were bound to hit someone in the eye, but a few months ago they've placed a much lower max capacity, which tends to fluctuate. Sometimes they make you wait to enter when there are barely any people inside. And other times the place is completely packed.

Do they have different max capacities for different days of the week? The person stopping us didn't say why we couldn't go in when there only a few people in the bar, which you could obviously see. That was kind of blah...

But besides that experience, I've had a good time at the Mix. They have a really neat outdoor patio in the back with heaters in case it's cold. And they have special dollar off drinks depending on the night of the week. $3 pint for people who work in the Castro is really nice. I ordered the Summer Ale on tap and it was delicious with the perfect amount of head. :)
author: Xavier G.

description:
Sssshhh!  

Don't tell anybody about my favorite little gem of a patio bar tucked away around the corner of the heart of the Castro!  We don't want the rest of the world coming in and crowding us out.

Where else in the Castro can you hang out with your friends on a heated patio, drink your beer, smoke your ciggypoo AND eat your hamburger/veggieburger/chickenburger, fries, taquitos, jalapeno poppers, onion rings, etc?

THE best place for a Martini or Manhattan or Cosmo.  The secret(s)?  Sylvia, Nicole and Sloan.  The gals make the best mixed drinks.  The guys are good, but nobody beats Sylvia's Bloody Marys.  Soooo tasty!  Actually, most of the guys that work there are pretty tasty looking - and friendly too.
author: Drew S.

description:
The back porch really makes this bar... but more than anything is the fact that I can bring my dog, Bumper, along with me to the Mix anytime... and he really loves the bar (a bit more than me, I think).

Perhaps my favorite part of the bar right now is the holiday drink specials... which feature everyones holiday favorite... a hot buttered rum (wow, do they put a hell of a lot of butter in that or what... time to go to the gym... again... that and NEVER need chapstick after drinking one). 

Love it.
author: Jordan Y.

description:
I love the Mix.  This has been my favorite Castro bar for years.  The management knows what they are doing.  The staff is great (though sometimes moody, but who says the patrons aren't sometimes moody).  When it is good, it is good!

The crowd is friendly, and you'll feel like you have a friend.  Unless you are a psycho, then, like everywhere else, people will avoid you like the plague.  Same at the Mix.  If you're friendly, they're friendly.

As to the Patio, it is the best part of the bar.  A recent commenter said it is "barely open."  I don't find that to be the case at all.  Unless you are there between 6 and 10 am (Yes, they open at 6!), or after 10 on a week night, the patio is closed.  Otherwise, it is good times in the back!

Thanks, Mix, for great times over the years!
author: Mike K.

description:
$3 Tequila Slushy. Flavors include Lemon, Raspberry and Strawberry. 

Arriving at 11:00am for a slushy and seeing tranny messes on the patio was the perfect way to start the afternoon. But the kicker was returning after a long day in the park at 5pm and the SAME tranny messes were still there. 

I could live in San Fran, I really could and the Mix only adds to my love of this neighborhood.
author: Tyler J.

description:
The sign of a good bar is one in which you have been there more than once and yet you can't give a good review. Is it because you had so much fun with your friends that you don't get into the surroundings? Is it because your drunk? It is bc it is a good bar with little fighting and few bitchy bartenders? hmm not sure. 

This bar has a back patio - which is great to get some air, smoke (not me people - those are cancers sticks)  and not breathe  in the smell of sweat. The girl at the back bar Friday night was awesome! She was fast, nice and didn't F up any orders. Also, we changed our mind a few times and most bartenders would give an eye roll - she totally put up with us. Great prices - we had 4 drinks for $17!

This place would get 5 stars IF: 
THEY CLEANED THE BATHROOMS (horrendous bathrooms -  hold back breaking  the seal as long as possible) and if,
 there were straight hot men for me...
author: Jessica L.

description:
Truly a cute little neighborhood bar.

I love that they have their back patio - it is essential to sunny and bright days during the weekend.

There drinks are average priced, and I don't think I've ever had to ask them to remake a drink (if it's not poured and mixed correctly, I will - and have - but not with this place.) 

It's cool because you can pretty much request your own music, via Jukebox, and play some pool inside. Or you can step outside and listen to whatever music, enjoy the weather, laugh and giggle with friends, enjoy a tasty cigarette, and if you come on Sundays...they make a pretty decent burger as well. Always nice to soak up the liquor!

All in all, a cute and fun place. Definitely check it out if you haven't already. :)

Aside from the great environment, they are constantly holding great fund raisers for people in the community - local sports teams, people running marathons or doing the Life Cycle, or any other number of amazing and worthy causes.

My favorite moments are when the entire back patio breaks out in song. Oh, you think I'm kidding? Just this past Saturday they were playing the "Grease MegaMix" and everyone (gay and straight) sang along, while a few of us (yes, I'd be one) did a little dance in place. It was quite wonderful and truly memorable, and I can say that it's only places like this that it'll happen. LOVE IT!
author: Nicolas H.

description:
I got drunk.  I think this place had something to do with it.  How did I get home?  I don't remember walking?

The crowd was very unattractive but for some reason got better and better looking as time went by.  Was it the booze?  Yeah. It was the booze.

This was a great place to lower my expectations before going to scablands.  Made it seem like I was walking onto the set of a model shoot there.

I know for a fact I will be back.  The people were friendly the drinks were strong and the bartender out back was a hoot.
author: Ian M.

description:
Cute neighborhood gay bar in the Castro. No attitude and really strong drinks. the back bar is thebest area to sit outside and get drunk:) 
Like Juan L said-- yea if you are pee shy hmm go somewhere else as the urnals are almost facing everyone as you go by! and the sink is out in the open bar area.. trashY!!
author: Christian P.

description:
Oh, what memories this place brings! 

The bartenders are excellent drinks as far as cocktails-in-a-bar go. My absolute favorite part of this place is the back patio. It has a "tent" feel to the patio - you gotta go to understand. It's also heated. BIG plus on the cold SF nights.

Nice size, I would say. The crowd is of the 25-45 range. What a great place to just chill.
author: Sharelle W.

description:
so so.......not really a super hip vibe but there are some cool peeps there on the weekend starting off the night.

Beware of spme of the bar thenders they think their the end all be all of bartenders.  (serving 3 dollar frozen margs).

The outdoor patio is great tho on a nice day. :)
author: Fred R.

description:
Really DIG the hidden back patio. Great happy hour specials. Pitchers for 6 bucks. I almost thought I was in college with that deal! Bartenders were WAY cool and accomidating to my boy and I. Our pitcher was half full when the keg went out and he just gave it to us. One and a half pitchers for 6 bucks? Yes Please! The back patio has heat lamps for those cold nights, and we were lucky enough to catch a drunk tranny mouthing off to a big queen/diva. Was that good wholesome SF entertainment or what? The table next to us were burning bowls throughout the night and nobody seemed to mind. That's always a plus! Good spot to chill and have a drink. 
P.S. Girls/Boys share a bathroom stall with a locking door. So if your to nervous to pee in public, you may want to take a potty break before you come.
author: monika l.

description:
this place would be the chillest bar, i say. chill crowd and chill environment.. pretty small though but i don't mind.

what's interesting is their patio. patio is where everyone stays since inside is where the oldies are. everyone would probably feel inclusive coming in since you can see a whole mix of different people. i mean, it's called "the mix" for a reason, no?
author: Marc K.

description:
I wish the patio wasn't always so crowded, some nights I'd really like to sit and smoke, but most of my visits have found standing-room-only crowds. 'Course, I could always not smoke and hang out near the pool tables, but that's not as fun.

The crowd is more accessible and friendly than any other Castro area bar I've visited, but I'd reccomend bringing a friend along anyway. Most of the people I've encountered here travel in herds, so it's not easy to visit when you're alone.
author: Jere K.

description: I've only been 3x, granted 2 of the bartenders are obnoxious and rude, I still dig this place. It's a place you can meet good people, young and old.
author: Joseph M.

description: A very unpretentious gay bar in the Castro. The Mix refers to the crowd and in my experience it's always been a pretty good mix of diverse people. Drinks are fairly priced and they have good Happy Hour specials. The back porch is the place to be, though it can get a little overwhelming with smokers. But if they have the retractable roof down, more circulation happens. A laid back place that I enjoy often. Perhaps a little too often.
author: Jeff R.

description: Oh I love this neighborhood spot.  Quiet-ish, great patio, locals, good drinks, wonderful and perfect.
author: Aaron W.

description:
When they call themselves "the neighbourhood bar," they mean it: it looks quiet and unassuming (and TINY) from the outside, but enter and it feels like EVERYONE in the Castro is at this bar - it's packed from Friday afternoon to Sunday night. Everyone from the trendiest twink to the lustiest lesbian pops up at the patio for a drink or a dozen, and even random straight kids such as myself will feel welcome.

I just wish it were a little bit bigger to accomodate all those people - I mean, yeah, we're all friends here so I have no objection to getting up close and personal... but I'm small (height-wise) and always get crushed in between two muscle daddies (who clearly aren't interested in me anyway). But besides the space issue, I always have a blast - this is one of the friendliest bars in one of the friendliest neighbourhoods in San Francisco, and there's always someone cool to chat with in addition to the already-cool friends who bring you here.

Also, the mixed-gender bathroom (stalls and urinals) provides for some hilarious repartee when you're a stall-using straight girl in a crowd of sassy, urinal-using gay guys. And how adorable is that banner in front that features people all holding martini glasses?
author: Joanne C.

description:
Let's be honest - this place is a total dive. The pain is falling off the walls, the floors are concrete and the back patio furniture looks like it's going to collapse at any moment. 

BUT, unlike many other gay bars, you won't find a hint of pretentiousness at The Mix. Guys aren't there to cruise or look you up and down and give you that "God, he's fat" eye-roll. The Mix is a simple and honest place to meet friends for a beer or two. Is it a great place to stay all night? Definitely not. I'd suggest grabbing a few drinks at The Mix and heading to The Cafe for dancing (Badlands is SO over). 

If you venture out to The Mix, check out the tranny regular. She/he is pure entertainment. She speaks in some foreign alien language no one understands and I don't think anyone really knows where she comes from. Amazing.
author: David P.

description:
Without the back patio, this bar wouldn't get my attention.

My friend and I stopped in for a beer yesterday and we perched ourselves on the bench, soaking in the sights and engaging in a very deep conversation about San Francisco gays.  He was approached by a very aggressive man who made us both a bit uncomfortable, but I guess that's the price you pay when you're a cute 22-year old (my friend, not me).  

On our way out, I stopped to talk to a friend who was near the exit.  This scary old man who sometimes stalks me punched my friend in the side when he walked by us.  I guess he thought we were together.
author: Marcus C.

description: Great Location and the Crowd is very good. You can either hangout and have a drink or play a game of pool.  The staff was very pleasant and when it took awhile to change a keg, they were very nice and made up for the wait.
author: Rix G.

description: This place is great. Classy, busy on the weekends (but not TOO busy) roomy, great drink variety, and a lovely back patio. The bathroom is interesting. I guess the biggest plus of the evening is my new friend who one of the bartender's has a crush on. He supplied me with a variety of good, free, STRONG drinks all night long. I can't complain.
author: Natalye R.

description: There's usually a good crowd and you really can't beat the location, BUT that unisex bathroom is super disgusting!
author: Lisa R.

description: I've always liked this bar, and I think I've seen at least three name changes in the past 14 years.  The bartenders are always nice and friendly, and the drinks are poured reasonably well (like at the Eagle in SOMA). The crowd is friendly to people they don't know, and the best thing about this bar is the small pattio in the back.
author: Sam A.

description:
As a hag to a, well, a gay man, it all began on a Wednesday night in June.  Ever since then, I often come here late at night on Wednesdays and occasionally Friday/Saturday nights.  The bartenders are ridiculously nice, almost to the point where you have to wonder if they're working you for tips, but it doesn't matter as they always end up giving us free rounds because we return the ambiguous, friendly favor with our, well, our generous tips. The drinks are heavy on the sauce, so I stick with MGD (if I'm driving) and it's entertaining to see which way Nick or Gil will open my bottles.

They have a jukebox with all of the classic songs as well as modern-day radio shit; a pool table that is always in use; touch-screen video games; and a nice little lounge area surrounded by blue lights.  My favorite thing about this bar (aside from the bartenders) are the coat hooks. They're everywhere!  Any bar with a place for my purse and my bffs' murse is fine by me.  The back patio is a decent size, enough to fit at least 30-40 people (as was the case the whole weekend of Pride) and it has a nice cozy, private lounge across from the back bar.  It also has gas heaters, televisions inside and out, and retractable awnings.  It is often used by us smokers, so if you're looking for a smoke-free patio, I'd suggest you take your pink lungs and look elsewhere.  

As far as the patrons go, its the usual kindness you would expect from drunk people - easy to mingle with anyone of all ages, especially if you, a gay man, wear plaid.  As far as the women, occasionally you will have your group of lipstick lesbians who make fun of everybody.  By everybody, I mean they will directly talk shit about you, your friend(s), the bartender you ordered from, the guy you were standing next to, the guy he was standing next to, and the air that you, "all aren't worthy enough to breathe," all within a 11-inch radius of your ears. It makes for a good laugh to know that they want to think that they're giving everyone a hard time, even though they aren't, because they're THAT insecure and attention hungry.  Aside from the lipsticks, you have your friendly scissors, hags, and supporting straight men, so its easy to not feel out of place, whatever sexuality you are. But then again, that's just how the city is. 

Oh, and did I mention the fish bowl full of free condoms?
author: shannon s.

description:
This bar (formerly Uncle Berts) is one of the few bars in the Castro that is woman-friendly, and one of two that isn't owned by either Les Natali or Greg Brownstein. (I never really understood why those two would buy up every bar, and make them exactly the same, and have them cater to the exact same clientele.) The drinks are reasonably priced, and the bartenders (the ones I know are Sloan, JR and Sylvia) are friendly, down to earth, not pretentious, experienced, and know their drinks. Many of the regulars are friendly, grounded people...

Tip your bartender! And if you've been tipping $1 a drink for 20 years...I hate to break it to ya, time to raise the tip...it's no longer considered an excellent tip....
author: Nick M.

description:
Um.

Going to the Mix is like going to some gay man's house who knows how to party.

The whole bar is half taken up by a bar. One to your left as you walk in and another one on the patio.

Had a delicious time here on Pride, just being able to mix it up with the crowd. The crowd was off beat, but it was nice to see the faces of the neighborhood. The music didn't stop (well it did a few times with the shotty sound system) but the inebration from the strong drinks held down as a capable filler.

I'd go when it's busy however, if you stumble by and it seems empty - it might seem more dive-y then a party. 

Note: The jukebox here blows.
author: Kim D.

description: Great vibe! Reasonable drinks that are stiff, strong and promptly served. Cool hangout place complete with covered patio, outdoor bar and heat lamps (an SF necessity!). Friendly bartenders and very pet friendly! Great music, especially on the weekends! Fun happy hour place to hang out, unwind and just chill with friends!
author: Joey M.

description:
This is the grown up more mature cousin of The Bar on Castro. Mostly 30 to 40  something guys hanging out in the back patio chatting it up and cruising one another. The patio is definitely  the main attraction especially on the weekends when it is sunny.  There is a bar in the back patio  and they have a grill where they sell  burgers or barbecue on certain nights or on the weekends. (never had the food) 

Inside there is a long bar and a pool table but not much room to shake your botty. I usually stop by before going to the B.O.C.
author: Teddy d.

description: I like  this bar is olways something new n new fgaces , plus strong drinks, friendly stuff good gender mix  crow,  freindly for  your four legged  freinds  too :).  cheers!
author: Mauricio R.

description: Fun local bar... a great "Mix" of gay and lesbian people, and straight... a little bit of everyone... would have gave 5 stars but I dont smoke and the patio sometimes reeks of smoke...
author: chris c.

description:
A good place to grab a drink before heading elsewhere.  I like it because the drinks are good and cheap, bartenders are friendly and you can smoke outside on the patio.  I don't like it here because it 
kind of smells funny and can get really crowded.
author: Valerie D.

description:
I came here two days in a row. Once on a Friday and then on a Saturday. I came here with a friend who frequents the bar and we hung out inside and outside. 

It's strange going there on guy nights and being a straight girl because a straight guy will probably hit on you. But all in all, I had a great time. Lots of laughs especially when you're waiting in line to use the restroom. Only one stall and a couple urinals. Not the cleanest thing in the world, but when are bar bathrooms ever squeaky clean?

Best thing is to get drunk and walk across the street to get some pizza at 2am. :P
author: Grace L.

description:
The bartenders are moderately unattentive.  The drinks are... drinkable.  The inside bar area is crowded and when it's busy there is clearly not enough room for people AND the pool table.  I'd give all that 3 stars.

The 4th star is for the patio.  The thing that makes this patio better that the Pilsner's on a hot Saturday afternoon:  the fan that mists water into the air, thus making everything a little moist and a lot cooler.  

If it's not a hot Saturday afternoon or if you don't particularly like water spraying fans then stick to the Pilsner.
author: LeSLiE W.

description:
The Mix is my new favorite Castro spot after they closed down The Pendulum (that FagLands asshole!). It's women-friendly, the gals working at the bar make pretty tasty drinks (nevermind the bartender guys, they're pretty high on themselves and their twinky bodies...specially that shirtless douchebag. *looks at douchebag*), there's a patio where you can sit down and eat some American grubs like a cheeseburger or some jalapeno (alt+164) poppers.

The crowd is rather mixed. Specially towards the end of the week, when some brown and asian folks will come out. I'm just happy to see people who don't necessarily look like your typical Castro clone. There'll be chunky guys, tall guys, short guys, guys in their 20's, 30's and 40's... all behaving properly and having a good ol' time. And not many old guys either, thank God. No offense, you daddies out there. But sometimes it feels like if it's not the gym-bunnie/Abercrombie ficticious TV-shit, it's grey haired hairy men who'll grab your butt at random.  The Mix is NOT that. And that's what's been making it special recently.
author: Tomas V.

description:
One of the best bars in the city. The bar exemplifies a neighborhood bar even with its large(r) size.

It has great drinks specials and constant fundraisers for the LGBT community. 

A go to place!
author: Art A.

description:
DRINKS are STRONG! 

After lunch my friend and I had to walk our lunch off. During the walk we got thirsty and we looked to our right...there was The Mix. We ordered two vodka tonics and it was soo worth the money. Bartender liqueured me up at 2PM.
author: K L.

description:
Aaaw, the memories, this was a while back, but felt like just yesterday. I can never forget the Mix:

My friend had just come back from college and a group of 3 of us went out to the castro for dinner and celebrating. After dinner and dessert, went looking for bar for a quick drink because my friend was really craving a martini. 
Well, one martini turned into 2 and 2 into 3 and a long island, & a tequila shot....so we went over and turned on the jukebox, switched on Lady Marmalade and watched the whole bar come alive, singing, dancin and everything. 

We were in the chill spot in the back corner chatting it up and dancing with a couple of guys when I got a tap on my shoulder. "You girls have gotta go." I chuckled and continued my conversation ...I got tapped again..."You girls have got to leave, like right now"...It then dawned on me, "this man is serious and talking to me and we are getting kicked out, oh shit".....In shock we got our stuff and left...

I had a great time there, the drinks were cool for the size and price, the people friendly for the most part...just sucks for getting kicked out because we got the party started but oh well....
author: Maya L.

description:
Only once or twice have I graced the wooden halls of the Mix in the castro, and I have to say that I have left intrigued each time...but never do I make it back. I think I will attempt to do so, since I need to get hit on in some capacity.

The space is actually pretty decent in size, with a lot of room in the front...it never gets crowded like badlands or the BOC, but it has it's own following. The back was really cool, when I went they had some little party thing going on and were serving drinks.

The people were cool...the staff was nice and I really liked the atmosphere. I will visit this place again and update this review....5 star potential.
author: James J.

description:
I love pre-gaming at the Mix, because despite the 'tudes of the bartenders do display, they always rock out my own signature drink, which is not easy to make. SOME of them even remember it by name...so ask for a Poison Apple sometime ;)


I haven't really spent -too- much time here..but I did get randomly made out with by two really hot guys...which is more than I can say in kissing ratio to any other bar. The Mix is a chill joint to hit up if you arent in the clubbing mood.
author: Rylan S.

description:
Just your average boring little neighborhood bar with good prices on strong drinks.  Bartenders are super nice.  Was there twice over the last week with some friends who live there in San Francisco.  The second time was not as crowded as the first time and reportedly the Fire Marshall had been there the night before with some enforcement about capacity, so we had to wait for a few folks to leave before we could go in.  Once inside, it seemed nearly empty compared to the first night.  

Only thing unusual,  there seemed to be a high percentage of men there.  ;)
author: Brian L.

description: This place is great and draws a pretty groovy crowd. They've got pool inside and there's a great back patio. Cute guys too.
author: Matt N.

description: 4 stars! went on a crowded sat night, met up w friends that were visiting from LA, had an incredible time! 4 stars, even after having my iPhone stolen out of my purse!
author: Enjoying Each Momen T.

description: Very Cheap! You can get drunk here for very little money and the crowd is neither sketchy nor looking for hook-ups. Very relaxed atmosphere with outdoor patio that is heated and covered during the colder times. People can smoke on the patio, which is kind of annoying as a non-smoker, but can deal with it. Bartenders are very nice and the drinks are big and deceivingly strong. Perfect go to place to start your night before you go somewhere else to dance.
author: Kevin H.

description:
There is never a dull moment at the Mix. Friendly folks, stiff - STIFF - drinks (guess what I get) and the prices are oh so reasonable. My partner in crime, Valerie, and I have decided that this place is our default bar. When I say meet in the Castro, we just assume there till we decide to scoot elsewhere. 

Thanks Mix for making a pretty shy gay boy feel welcomed.
author: Allen B.

description: My friends and I go to The Mix pretty regularly (enough to at least know why everyone in the bar yells 'Debbie' whenever someone breaks a glass).  It's a good, chill spot to start a night out in the Castro, or have a drink on the patio on a sunny weekend afternoon.  Sunday beer bust can be fun and is a good deal, but gets fairly crowded.  Like most Castro bars, no credit cards are accepted so bring cash.  Drinks are very fairly priced both during and after happy hour, and you most definitely get more than what you pay for on the mixed drinks!
author: Dan B.

description: Aw...this was my first castro bar ever. I loved it then and love it now. Its a nice change from the the normal bars that the gays usually hit up. Fun mix of people, pool tables and cheaaap drinks. I love the patio and the larger bathroom. I was satisfied with the other one but uhh,,,you know. Its kind of small inside(which is the running theme with some of the 'stro bars) but make friends and smoosh together. its worth it.
author: Spencer N.

description:
Lately I've been feeling a little depressed. Don't worry, I'm fine and I have no inclination to throw myself off the GG bridge and the eye makeup isn't running down my cheeks yet -- besides I've never been one of those perpetually peppy people who always accentuate the positive -- but I kind of want to go to sleep for a long time, like FOREVER. Know what I mean? Maybe it has to do with my broken penis pump or longing for my immortal beloved or my usual post-Pride crash but frankly I feel like a fucking leper. I mean, shit, my self-hatred is even outpacing my misanthropy and everyone knows that rarely happens. Robert Burton told me the Ancient Greeks had a word for this -- melancholia (black bile) -- then devoted over a thousand turgid pages to chronicling it. Personally, I prefer the less-clinical FUCKED IN THE HEAD. I know you're saying: THAT'S WHAT YOU AND YOUR ASS FACE GETS FOR WRITING SHITTY REVIEWS, MONKEY BOY! And: cry me a river! Like you're the only one who's felt like that! To which I say: fuck you. And: WHERE'S MY ZOLOFT/STOLI/TWINK PORN/LOADED GUN?

So in an effort to exorcise the emo demon, some friends brought me to The Mix for booze and boys since the best way to cure problems is by becoming an alcoholic who will bone anyone with a pulse. Also, Jesse Helms just passed and I wanted to celebrate his contributions to society by possibly giving some hot male ass a tongue bath. We passed the interior bar, the pool table, the plank benches, and made our way for the second bar on the back patio where the smokers congregate under gas heaters. It's not my favorite bar in the world, but the drinks are fairly priced, the pours are steady, and the folks aren't full of themselves unlike a lot of the other Castro haunts. I sat there, Tom Collins in hand, inhaling second-hand smoke, calming my nerves and feeling better about myself, when I noticed this guy across us staring at me.

Me [to Friend]: Hey, see that guy?
Friend: Which one?
Me: The one in the blue hoodie, brown hair. He's on the other side of the patio, smoking. Kind of to your right.
Friend: Oh yeah...Oh shit, he's totally checking you out!
Me: I know!
Friend: So?
Me: Well, he's pretty cute.
Friend: Yeah, so go over and talk to him.
Me: Huh? Shit, you know I stink at talking to strangers. Plus I feel retarded right now.
Friend: Yeah, yeah, yeah, whatever. You're fine. Look, he's clearly looking at you. Over half your work is done.
Me: I guess you're right
Friend: Fuck yes I am. GO! [nudges me in the side]
...
Me: Hey.
Dude: Uh...hey.
Me: I'm Darin. What's up?
Dude: I'm R______. So, Darin, aren't you that crazy gay guy on yelp?
Me: Um...yes.
Dude: Yeah, that's what me and my friends thought...OKAY, it's getting chilly out here, I'm heading inside. Buh-bye.

WHAT THE FUCK?!? AAAAAAAAAGGGGGHHH!!! DO YOU THINK IT'S TIME FOR ME TO TONE IT DOWN?!?!
author: d s.

description: I liked this bar, very low keyed ( at least when I was there). Good Drinks and a place to drink and talk. The music was not that loud, so you weren't shouting at each other. They have a patio too with a bar, so you can order drinks out there too and not come back inside.  I would go back too.  Pool table too. Also mixed crowd girls and boys...
author: Susie S.

description: A friend of mine dragged me to his side of the sandbox last night and suggested this bar because it has a large outdoor patio. I am usually resistant to crowded places, but this wasn't too bad. Because of the heat, we had their frozen margaritas, which were kind of pricey at $8 for a tall, but they were pretty strong, so there you go. Alas, the most memorable part of this experience (for me) was observing the preparation of one of their house specialty shots ... the "Ovarian Burst." It looks just as disgusting as it sounds -- plus contains butterscotch liqueur, which is even more vile to me than the gelatinous bloody clot floating inside the shot glass. My buddy was upset because a really butch lesbian was wearing the exact same outfit he was, but looked so much better than he did. Who says a night in the Castro can't be entertaining?
author: Gregor G.

description: Friday night happy hour, and if it's cold, the two kerosene heaters will be blazing hot and the roll-back tarp will be closed---Otherwise, the open patio has a nice SF garden feeling, stuck between all the buildings like it is.  It's nice and crowded on Fridays so we like to get pitchers of Stella or MGD, to reduce the need for trips to the bar through the Happy Hour traffic.  Even though the music can be inconsistant and sometimes non-existant, I usually don't care because it's a great place to hang out with friends and catch up.  Alas, for the Uncle Bert's days; but life is change, and Mix is still my favorite spot in the Castro.
author: Randy F.

description: I just read there is ladies night on wednesdays, so i may check that out... i went here for the first time last night (a saturday).  it's bigger than it looks, because they have the largeish patio out back. it wasnt too crowded - we got there at 11 something maybe? and got a table.  this is not a place where you will find many cute people, men or women, (except us) but everyone seemed to be having a good time.  the music was pretty quiet. i guess u can get food there too.  i'd stopped in there once solely to use the bathroom and i like the weird slidey door. they also have pool tables. i'm just not a bar person. so, its ok. good for meeting friends before you go someplace i guess. and i will eventually check out the ladies night. cuz well, there's ladies, and i dont have to wander far from my house to see them. lol.
author: Merredith L.

description:
They pour the drinks really strong here.  They have specials every night and long happy hours, until midnight on sunday.    

The patio is always very crowded.  You can bring your dog, but I think it is a little too crowded and rowdy for a dog to enjoy it there later in the eveing and on sundays.  It is a good mix of men, friendly, all types, with very few women. 

Like most gay bars, the music isn't really my style, but they throw in some Yeah Yeah Yeahs between the thumpy gay boy music.  There is a jukebox with a decent selection.
author: Carla K.

description: Oh, The Mix. This was my replacement for my 'default' bar when I moved out here from Indianapolis. It is ordinary and about 80% predictable- both in very good ways. It is the type of bar you keep going to because you know you'll see the same people. So don't be a jerk or walk around like you own the place, because everyone will remember.
author: Alex W.

description: A lovely heated patio to meet old friends, and make new ones. Fair warning that there seems to be a higher than average ratio of batshit crazy patrons, but really--that just adds to Mix's charm.
author: Tamara B.

description: The Mix is normally really dirty.  When I walk in, I feel like I shouldn't touch anything.  The reason I do enjoy the Mix is because I strategically use it to my advantage.  If I'm looking to smoke a clove or something and it's "too cold" to stand outside without a jacket, then I'll hit up the Mix because there is no cover, and you can smoke in the back area that is tented and has gas heaters.  The bartenders didn't seem too knowledgeable, but the drinks are stiff.  All-in-all this bar is alright, but it isn't the best place to go to on Castro.
author: Brent A.

description: They have a smoking area and I always feel like I am getting ripped off for some reason when I go here, it is a very friendly homey bar and I like it but there is something that I dont like about it that bothers me in my mind grapes.
author: Ryan O.

description: I like this place because the cruising queers aren't here.  The folks are generally people who want to shoot pool, have a good drink and be around friendly company.  It's a nice oasis away from the madness of the other places in the area.  Oh, and if you happen to be with friends, take control of the jukebox, and you can have your own "private party" in the Castro.  Weekday or weekend, it's a nice place to be.
author: Dudley F.

description: i like the outside space here, but it's not anything that special.  it's gritty.  If it weren't for the people, I probably wouldn't really go here again.  It's ok.  I mean booze is booze right?
author: Nick G.

description: Drinks are cheap and the bartenders are super friendly. The back porch is a bonus. Overall a great place to meet friends and enjoy some cocktails.
author: Valerie G.

description: An unpretentious little place. Has a bit of a dive bar feel to it but without the smell, so it's obviously kept clean. Friendly staff, very stiff drinks, and the most mixed crowd I've seen so far on my trip to this city.
author: Donovan S.

description:
drama city
laughable characters

great bartenders, great drinks
lively place

but a small and cramped pool table..

but then again i come here to see and play with the guys.
author: tanner r.

description: NO pretense here. The bar is simple and dark, and the people who frequent this place are people that I like to talk to. The attitude is checked at the door, and that makes this place great! The drinks are great and always strong too! And if you like to play pool, there's a pool table for you to enjoy!
author: Guy F.

description: I was going to meet my friend because we were going to study together we stopped on Castro St  for what was supposed to be a cup of coffee. After finding parking I found myself not studying but inside the mix drinking Bloody Mary after Bloody Mary. The drinks were strong and the sun was shining so fuck it we drank and Drank and I would do it again.
author: Kim R.

description:
Disclaimer. Im not a fan of the castro bars. 

I really dont go out much in the castro. I have had bad experiences on most of the visits. 

I went to the mix with a friend late one night. The bar itself looked really small on the outside but was surprisingly bigger on the inside. My friend and I both ordered beers and the prices were reasonable and the bartender was really nice. After several rounds, the bartender gave me a free round. I played a round of pool and was enjoying the bar alot. It began to get more crowded later in the evening so you had to wait for a table. 
I met a lesbian couple who my friend and I played at pool. They were very cool and seemed to like the bar as well. They said they liked it more than most of the bars in the area b/c it had a more comfortable feel. I can see what she meant. The other bars seem to have a superiority complex. 
The deck was really good too. The bartender outside was friendly as well and it was a great night. I havent been back since but would go back. 
Did I mention they have really cheap drinks?
author: Adam B.

description:
great place to watch the game!  we came here this past weekend remembering the tv's from the last time we were there (cuz they kept distracting my tv-lover of a wife).  at the front bar, we planted ourselves right in front of the big one!  

i think they usually have a special, and when it's beer, i'm golden!  the bartenders are nice and they don't give you small drinks for big drink prices!  the crowd is favorable, they're chill but get excited when it's time to get excited!  the pool table is always being used, but i'd rather watch anyway.  it's like a gay bar not in the castro, but it's in the castro.  

not a fan of the bathroom though, but when ya gotta go, you just go!

get drunk here, i always do!
author: Monk R.

description: Awesome place! I stopped going only because I work too much now to enjoy the Sunday specials at this bar. I would go every sunday for the best beer/cocktail specials during the day...and the patio can be very loud with the occasional loud flamboyant guys blowing smoke in my face...but other then that I always have fun playing pool and relaxing with friends here!
author: Michael H.

description: Great frozen drinks (at an excellent price), convenient location, relaxed atmosphere, nice bartender, friendly regulars, and really nice back patio...  which can result in an extremely full bar, because it is so popular.  Try it at different days and times... I am sure you will find the right "mix".  (ba-dum-dum)
author: Ross H.

description: Love love love the Mix, it's gotta be the friendliest bar in the Castro. Extremely dyke and hetero friendly and I must say that there's never a day that the drinks haven't been strong enough to send me out on my ass if need be. They now have a ladies night on Wednesdays that I'm tres excited to try out.  The bar staff is extremely friendly and they even hooked me up with some free drinks on my birthday. My favorite place to hang out when I just feel like going to the local spot. The Mix is so unpretentious you almost forget your in the Castro....see you there.
author: Marie B.

description: hairy shirtless bartender... wasn't really my thing, but didn't disgust me either.  he was a nice guy, made me a strong cocktail, which i appreciated.  Their back patio is awesome, but they didn't have that open last night... so... that wasn't that great.  The best thing about this place is that they open at 6 am, so if need be, you can start the day there.  perfection.  Plus, the company was good :)
author: Caleb D.

description: The Back Patio, the Great Staff and the Atmosphere of the Castro all make this place a great place to have a drink and meet great people. They have pool tables and 3 bars in this little place so you should have no trouble getting a drink!
author: jen t.

description:
Overall, The Mix is a great neighbourhood bar. Friendly people and staff (mostly) and an unpretentious atmosphere make for a good time for all. The back patio is a great space for hanging out rain or shine. I kinda miss the food back there I must say- but I guess the retrofit of the area is probably a better win. 

Bartenders are among the best in the Castro.  Wonderful people.

Overall, there is really no better place in the area- hands-down.
author: Anthony G.

description: Love coming here for a mellow drink or to get a little drunker and play pool.  Friendly staff know ya by name and drink :)  Fun with drag queens, bears, twinks, and just drinking buddies.  It truly is the Mix
author: Sean M.

description: 4 stars for the patio but its never open late enough in my humble opinion.  Cramp everyone in altogether on the inside and its not so fun.  The crowd is a little well, if you're from Fresno, you should feel right at home.
author: Sean S.

description: Some of the best bartenders in the Castro - Sylvia, J.R. and Sloane!   I've always been treated very well.   About the only place a gay guy can go to meet some fun lesbians.   I really like the VJ.  He plays good current music and slips in some classics for variety.  Also, this is one of the few (if not only) bars in the neighborhood that REGULARLY hosts benefits that help the gay community.    Pet friendly with cute, well-behaved doggies!
author: Michael S.

description: A very friendly neighborhood bar with an excellent back patio. Attracts an eclectic mix of folks, most of whom are far more polite than at the more "desperate" Castro haunts. Still, I miss the good old days when they didn't narc so much in the back... oh well.
author: Aaron L.

description: The back patio is great, although having spent the 2004 're-election' debacle here, it is bittersweet. The patio was closed last night, but perhaps as some sort of compensation, the bartender got in a fight with some guy who kept yelling about being 'accosted.' The bartender had the poor fellow face down on the floor, with his arm lodged firmly under the gentle-man's chin. The ribald youngster struggled gamely to stand up, trying to eschew the erstwhile barkeep by thrusting his ass into his attacker's groin area. But to no avail. When we left, he was still making sport of it, just grunting and grunting and grunting...
author: Big S.

description: I have to like this place no matter if it sometimes smells, the crowd is a bit, um, well sketchy, curmudgeonly ladies in the front (sorry ladies not all of you, just some), and the service is so-so.  Truly an original place.
author: J J.

description: The mix is fun.  I think my friend leo has a crush on the bartender, but my other friend told me he's straight.... Can we go to the transfer now?
author: Matt N.

description: Went here with a friend last night and luved it! Cheap, super strong drinks...seriously did they add any cranberry to my vodka cran? There were nice, fun ppl, American Idol was blasting in the background, ppl cheering to Obama and being a girl I didn't have to worry about being hit on by creepy boys! A fun night!
author: Sonya D.

description: Its open everyday at 6am.5 stars in itsself. A great Mix of Boys and Girls in the Castro with a awesome back patio. Friendly place, loud juke box, and they got a pool table too. The bartender can make a mean bloody mary, though they usually suggest a bottle of beer, hee hee
author: Missy I.

description: My partner and I, with a couple of friends in tow, decided to check out The Mix after meeting for dinner the other night. We have been several times before, but for one reason or another I have never gotten around to writing a review. We walked in the place was full, but not so much so that you couldn't breathe, we ordered drinks, and immediately headed to the back patio. We each had vodka tonics, and all I can tell you was that they were damn strong! Just the way I like them. We sat next to a cute lesbian couple, with the most adorable Labrador I have ever seen. They were so friendly, and we made friends right away. In fact, we met tons of cool people that evening. Bartender was friendly and fast, which is a plus in my book. We decided to go inside after awhile, as the friends we came with wanted to play pool. Stayed a couple of hours longer, and God knows how many drinks later, finally left and went home and promptly passed out. So glad we took Bart, 'cause I was 3 sheets by 12:00am. Another fun option for us when we venture to the Castro. Strong drinks, friendly patrons, and great bartenders! Four Stars!
author: Anthony K.

description: My absolute favorite bar in the Castro, because of the patio in the back.  Only problem is that they close it when it's not busy and make you smoke out front.
author: Kenneth K.

description: The drinks are cheap and strong at the Mix.  The bartenders aren't really that interested in talking to you.  I'm not a big sports fan so I don't often hang out here, but it makes a nice change sometimes.  The patio is relaxing, sometimes they have shows outside which are very entertaining.  The food served on the patio is not the best, I've tried it twice without enjoying it.  The pool table crowd can be a little annoying as they use up all the inside seats and don't look where they are jabbing with their sticks.  However all in all it's still a nice place to go once in a while.
author: Michael D.

description: Went here for a birthday party where I barely saw the birthday girl.  Fun place in the Castro, though.  It was crowded from the front all the way to the back patio where it was still so warm and muggy because of the sweaty bodies under heat lamps and shrouded in a dense miasma of smoke.  I'm willing to overlook all of this because the bartender made me an extra long island.
author: Marjorie B.

description: I have been an on-again/off-again regular of Mix since it opened.  The manager, Silvia, makes the most amazing margaritas and is one of Castro's most popular bartenders.  She really treats everyone with kindness even when super busy.  Linda on Sundays is pretty famous for her bloody mary's.  The bar really does get a mix--from gym bunnies to locals getting off work to chain smoking alcoholics with no teeth.  The owner, Larry, is often around and keeps the place clean and well-maintained.  One of the best outdoor patios around.
author: Richard N.

description: My friends and I would saunter over to the Mix on Sunday nights to watch the L word.  It's a pretty decent sized bar with a patio in the back.  If you are going to watch the L word, they have a bunch of flat screens around the bar, so you don't have to hover around one screen.  The bartenders are kind of aloof, in that I-am-cooler-than-you kind of way.  They have a pool table, for those of you who just want to be seen, but don't really care to watch the show.  The only gripe I have with this place is that they need more than one toilet!
author: jen n.

description: I really like this bar.  It's a gay sports bar and it fits both those descriptors very well.  There are always games on the tv and great eye candy.  They have an outdoor area that is covered and has heating lamps so you can smoke while drinking and not freeze your ass off.  They always have some kind of special drink which will be like $2-3.  It's pretty casual and has a good neighborhood feeling.
author: angela k.

description:
great locals bar with a rockin back patio.
always a fun time

thanks for sponsoring our Softball team!!!
author: Matt V.

description: The nicest staff in the Castro!  AND, the most welcoming patrons.  I love that the prices are not over the top and you get one mean drink for that low price!
author: Wen Z.

description: Good drinks and a great hidden back patio.  It even gets some sun when it is nice out.  Good margaritas.
author: Liz E.

description:
The back patio is the best.

Nice place to hang out on sunny weekend days.
author: kyoto s.

description: This use to be a great place to get drinks but I can never get a drink that tastes right anymore.
author: Justin T.

description: I just wanted to send a shout out to the staff @ Mix Bar.  What a great month of hosting all the World Cup Games,  and what a final weekend.  Thanks for a fantastic time.  cheers, t
author: tom s.

description: the back patio is kind of whimsical when you're on the right substance.
author: Jamie C.

description: love it, especially the back patio. but one star deducted for the straight male bartender who gave me 'tude. it's the castro - what are you even doing here?
author: Marla W.

description: After a crazy experience at a place which shall remain nameless, my friends and I came here to end the night. They didn't have a DJ, but  the music was so much better than where we came from, plus we had room to breathe. I liked how there was a long bench along the wall where people could sit. There's also a pool table which I had my eyes glued to for a good minute because the guy that was playing looked like he could be a professional. Interesting part for me was when I headed to the restroom. Theirs is co-ed. I didn't even experience that in college. Awkward? No, not really. Although it would've been nice if my guy friend had closed the stall door before going about his business (#1 mind you). I was so close to walking in on him. O_o This would be ideal pre-party territory. I suggest that you try one of their shots. It's called, wait for it....a c*ck sucker. Sounds nasty, but tastes damn good. Don't knock it 'til you try it!
author: Rhia R.

description: Went there Friday night around 10.  Very stiff and yummy Long Island.  Not too crowded, mellow, but also not dull.  Good place to go after already having a couple drinks, and great for having another drink before dancing.  The three of us went to the back area and had a marvelous time chatting.  There were some Sisters there that evening, one who was lovely and kind enough to warm my freezing hands.
author: J B.

description: nice drink prices, fun back patio. i am hetero and lived in the castro for awhile- which i loved: safe, pretty, everything open late- and mix was a place i frequented. i always felt welcomed and always got really really in bad form drunk. the crowd is fun, the music is loud but good luck trying to get in a game of pool - the space is a little crowded, and i think the bathroom borders on rank but hey after you're drunk .....its all good.
author: Adrienne P.

description: heat lamps for the smoking patio that has seating = double sweet, double stars.  another star for having the kind of place where gays will actually have a friendly conversation with a female unlike the queens ELSEWHERE (read: badlands) who are strictly on the prowl. another star for no cover. i cant remember if i was too tanked to remember my drink here or if i had the presence of mind to pass. ill have to drink a double upon my next visit and amend this review
author: Miz C.

description: i'm tired so i'll keep it quick... this place is great for hanging out and having a few with the friends. not too loud, everybody's nice and they have a back patio for smoking. it's a little old, but you feel comfortable being there.
author: Steve B.

description: This place has an awesome hidden patio out back.. It's a chill neighborhood bar with friendly bartenders, strong drinks, and a very mixed clientele. Expect the patio to be buzzing on a sunny afternoon.
author: Michael H.

description: Overall a really great bar.  I typically hang out at the front bar and avoid the back patio as I am someone that does not tend to like alot of people in a small space.  The bartenders are super friendly, the drinks are great and it is fun watching the regulars playing pool when they are drunk.  The Mix has two different crowds as well which is kind of unique for a Castro Bar.  The front is a little more laid back and the back is more roudy.  Basically it is a great bar for everyone regardless of what your crowd may be.  I only wish this bar would hop on the band wagon and accept credit cards.  Until they do this I cannot give them a 5 star rating.
author: Jeremy S.

description: I always stop in here to have a beer when I am in town.  I give it three stars for the patio as I smoke; patio is always open whenever I have been there.  The little tiny gal there that bartends is a real sweetie.  A couple of the staff can be extremely rude so I simply avoid them.  Someone else here mentioned the tranny regular who speaks in a foreign language that no-one understands.  I also get a kick out of her/him; have never heard her/him speak a word of English.  She speaks some sort of jibberish with crazed fits of laughter every few minutes.  I always say hello to her and she smiles and then mumbles incoherently for several minutes before falling into another fit of laughter.  I want whatever she is on.
author: Mario C.

description: This place is cool, the staff is cool and friendly. Drinks specials. Fun karaoke!
author: Samantha G.

description: It's ok out on the balcony, but unfortunately this is an open invitation for smokers so it's a double-edged sword. The bar itself is too small inside.
author: Michael G.

description: The mix is truely a magical place. im usually here after my pharm. parties and generally am non coherent. As it is they have a juke box which allows me to frantically snatch at the air as if im catching invisible flys while listening to some of sineads greatest hits. I'd be lieing if i said i didnt spend countless hours breathing on the mirror in the bathroom writting my name and then screaming "youre ugly! youre ugly!" For almost a year i had planned on running away from home and living under the pool table until i found out thats where they keep their alcohol. I stopped washing my hair after that.
author: youric v.
